Name: Lead Technical Application Analyst
Description: ADP is hiring an experienced Lead Tech Appl. Analyst with demonstrated experience in overseeing a team of analysts and have strong technical skills. Does this sound like you?We believe people make great companies, not the other way around. Our people make all the difference in delivering innovative HR technologies and solutions that help employees all over the world do their jobs better. The result? We're building the next generation of ADP technologies.Team Lead SummaryThe Technical Services Group (TSG) is made up of a team of roughly 10 to 15 Technical Application Analysts and Technical Support Advisors. This TSG team in particular supports the ADP Multinational Client (MNC) business unit with regards to the ADP Time and Attendance application. The Team Lead for this team will report to the Tech Services Manager and assist them in supervising the team. The Team Lead will need to be familiar with standard troubleshooting methodology for web based applications in order to understand the analysts and to act as a liaison for them with other groups within ADP, the development team, and even directly with clients when needed. The Team Lead is responsible for ensuring the performance of the team meets the set expectations and for addressing performance concerns raised by internal partners or at times even by the manager. The Team Lead will be expected to fill in for basic manager responsibilities when the manager is not present. The Team Lead will need to be able to be contacted outside of normal working hours in case a critical issue occurs and the analyst on call requires direction or connection with other resources. The Team Lead is expected to be able to coordinate team tasks and functions for the entire team as needed. Essential Duties for a Technical Analyst Team LeadTeam Lead oversees the team of analysts and helps to navigate roadblocks including communication barriers, lack of knowledge or resources, or unwarranted resistance from other parties needed to address the issue.Team Lead monitors quality through Service Request evaluations and other tools to make recommendations to enhance the client experience.Team Lead should review and approve knowledgebase entries of lower level analysts.Team Lead should formulate, prioritize and submit incident/enhancement requests and application modification recommendations to Product Development for prioritization and deployment in future releases. Review and provide recommendations and feedback on maintenance release content, product documentation, business design reviews. Manage the requests and delivery of one off fixes to Client Services, Hosting Services, and applicable ADP clients.Team Lead should monitor project work to make sure it is addressed appropriately and to make sure projects do not interfere with prioritization of critical issues.Team Lead should be included on calls regarding critical clients and should help drive the momentum forward as needed by the analyst.Team Lead's core responsibilities include monitoring and scheduling work assignments, providing performance feedback, and mentoring and training associates on product and/or process issues. Team Lead should work closely with the Management team to ensure associate development.Non-Essential Duties for a Technical Analyst Team LeadTeam Lead performs active troubleshooting and works cases as indicated for other analysts.Travel may be asked to travel both internationally and domestically on rare occasions.Preferred Education/Skills:Bachelor's Degree5-8 years of directly related experience in a related subject such as database administration or engineering; system administration; network administration; software application support / helpdesk experience.The ability to identify and avoid potential software conflicts.1 or more years of supervising technical resourcesRequired Education/Skills:High School DiplomaThorough understanding and background in the utilization of internet based software and/or utilities, as well as workstation management and basic networking.#LITECH#LI-AA2Software in the Cloud. Experts on the Ground:ADP powers the working world with comprehensive solutions that drive business success. Consistently named one of the "Most Admired Companies" by FORTUNE® Magazine, and recognized by Forbes® as one of "The World's Most Innovative Companies," ADP has over a half-million clients around the globe and 65 years of experience as one of the largest providers of human capital management solutions world-wide.At ADP, we believe that diversity fuels innovation. ADP is committed to equal employment opportunities regardless of race, color, genetic information, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, lawful alien status, national origin, age, marital status, or protected veteran status. We support an inclusive workplace where associates excel based on personal merit, qualifications, experience, ability, and job performance.

Name: Payor Policy Analyst
Description: Job Description  SCOPE OF THE JOB Under the direction of the Vice President of Operations, will be fully dedicated to the identification, research and communication of relevant Payor specific policies and guidelines to maximize revenue as related to coding, billing and reimbursement of medical services  ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS 1.Collects, analyzes, and interprets revenue-related policy data to support revenue cycle goals for the Business Groups by identifying and communicating policy information that impacts reimbursement.  2.Establishes and maintains collaborative, positive, effective, interpersonal relationships and communication with the Vice President of Operations, Business Group staff, Managed Care, Compliance and Payor representatives.  3.Perform special projects as requested by the Vice President of Operations and/or Business Group Managers.  4.Data mining, identify useful information for billing implications and work with management on interventions and solutions.  5.Critically evaluate information gathered from multiple sources, reconcile conflicts, deconstruct high-level information and uses findings to recommend changes to revenue cycle operations, with the goal of driving increasing profitability.  6.Work cooperatively and collaboratively with staff at all levels across the organization.  7.Modifies revenue management strategies in collaboration with management on the development of necessary system edits based on Payor policy information to reach targets  8.Develop and maintain structured tools as resources for billing purposes to be used by Business Group staff to include preparing, presenting and training groups of employees on policies and methods.  9.Participate in meetings and workgroups across all levels of personnel within and outside of the organization.  10.Continuously review and monitor Payor websites for information relevant to business functions.  SECONDARY FUNCTIONSUtilize Infonet and Payor sponsored websites for policies, research and information.Schedule and attend meetings as necessaryPromote critical and urgent deadlines be met by prioritizing and/or reorganizing workload when necessaryRespond to communication by reaching out to appropriate points of contact requiring support with Payor contract compliance and Payor policyOther duties as assigned TEMPERAMENT Adhere to company policies and procedures, demonstrate the core values and Hospitality behaviors, resolve conflict through open, honest, professional communication, demonstrate positive and enthusiastic attitude, keep supervisor and leadership apprised of issues, and seek opportunities to recognize others.Job Requirements  SKILLS Ability to work independently and with a team and maintain a high customer service focus  Demonstrates high attention to detail and accuracy and is organized in managing numerous projects  Ability to identify and seek needed information/research skills  Strong analytical and problem solving skills  Excellent oral, written, interpersonal and communication skills  Ability to handle proprietary information  Knowledge of Payor contracts, policies and third party insurance regulations to insure compliance  Consulting skills  Make decisions independently with minimal supervision, self-motivated and goal oriented  Ability to manage time effectively and meet deadlines imposed by either internal and/or external requirements (claim filing, reports, contract compliance)  Ability to read multiple formats of Payor remittance advice, explanation of benefits and overpayment remittance advice  Working knowledge with use of all Microsoft Office Suite applications with particular emphasis in Excel  Competent in Medical Management System, Epic preferred  Knowledge of CPT and ICD Coding and Medical Terminology of most current versions  Light typing  EXPERIENCE Five (5) years experience of health care experience in medical billing or related experience.  Computer experience in medical billing required.  Prior Epic system experience preferred.  Payor experience with claim processing and/or account receivable experience.  EDUCATION High School Diploma or GED equivalent required. Associate degree preferred. CPC preferred  EQUIPMENT & WORK AIDS Microsoft Office Applications Outlook, Excel, Word  Infonet and Web based Payor portals  Calculator  Telephone  Fax Machine  Photocopier  Coding Manuals (CPT and ICD current versions)  WORKING CONDITION Office environment# of Hires Needed 1

Name: IT Systems Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionIT Systems Analyst  The IT Systems Analyst collaborates with Operational Business Customers and other IT partners to collect and analyze information to formulate the scope and objectives of technology solutions. Conducts feasibility studies to design possible technology solutions. Writes system and programming specifications so that when the system is implemented it will meet user needs. Provides input into cost estimations and project plans. Prepares and maintains technical documentation including flow charts, models, and procedures, user guides, scorecards and reporting to assist with the ongoing operation and maintenance of technology solutions. Assigned to complex projects, systems or initiatives. IT Systems Analysts lead efforts, oversee work results, provide training and serve as a technical resource for other IT Systems Analysts on moderately complex projects, systems or initiatives. ESSENTIAL JOB RESPONSIBILITIES: Analyzes business requirements to determine technical requirements and identifies impacted areas/systems/processes and evaluates alternative solutions Researches and assists in designs solutions for general maintenance requests to resolve system problems Prepares detailed system requirements and assists in functional design solutions for new products/functionality and enhancements to existing products/functionality Assigned to complex projects, systems or initiatives. Provides input into forecasting and project-planning for scope/requirements documents and/or vendor contracts to minimize risk to on time, cost effective solution fulfillment. Prepares high level proposals that identify viable options to address the clients needs. Works with appropriate parties to gain approval of proposal and initiate work. Facilitates and/or partners with other IT staff to facilitate a systematic process for capturing requirements. Works with Operational Business Customers and other IT partners to capture requirements in a standard format that can serve as the foundation for developing technical documentation. Using SDLC processes and associated tools, analyzes current system targeted for replacement/enhancement to determine business and technical functions to be included in design. Works with Developers and other IT staff to determine system components and functional flow of components and data between components. May determine the best-suited technology to meet the business requirements. Creates detailed program specifications from which a developer can code. Validates the design documentation with the appropriate parties and receives approval on these documents. Reviews final design documents to ensure that they clearly explain the work expectations. Clarifies design expectations. Answers business and technical questions. Researches and involves appropriate parties to resolve more complex business and technical issues. Continuously assesses systems as business direction changes for impacts to existing designs. Understands impacts and works as appropriate to determine best solution. Provides consultative support for the systems within their product family Collaborates with the Operational Business Customers and other IT staff in the design and development of system requirements to ensure both fulfill the business and technical requirements Prepares technical documentation and deliverables including flow charts, models, and procedures, user guides, scorecards and reporting. Ensures adherence to practices, standards, policies and procedures. May liaise with vendors as assigned. Prepares detailed test scenarios and assists in test execution for various system components. Influences business/stakeholders and/or is instrumental in driving business decisions while proposing solutions built on Value Proposition Develops and documents vetted contingency plans in case of risks or roadblocks Advocates effective solutions that are flexible to accommodate future enhancements Responsible for consensus and relationship building between Business, IT teams and BRMs Accountable for clearly linking the IT solution to the business vision/strategy while coaching junior analysts to help them understand the business priorities. REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS:Bachelors degree in a related field or equivalent experience 4+ years related work experience.This includes progressive IT work experience in a systems/testing analyst roleThorough knowledge of Information Technology fields and computer systemsDemonstrated organizational, analytical and interpersonal skillsProficient in requirements gathering methodologies and the SDLC Understanding of typical architecture standards and ability to apply them in their design workAbility to manage tasks independently and take ownership of responsibilitiesAbility to learn from mistakes and apply constructive feedback to improve performanceAbility to communicate technical information clearly and articulatelyAbility to adapt to a rapidly changing environmentHigh critical thinking skills to evaluate alternatives and present solutions that are consistent with business objectives and strategy.Thorough knowledge and experience of systems, subsystems, development methodologies, systems architecture, tools and processes that support the assigned business initiative or systemAbility to collaborate with Operational Business Customers in the translation of business process requirements to technical requirements.PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:Bachelors degree in IT related fieldExperience using Agile methodologyGood understanding and experience with the business processes and systems used by theOperational Business Customers.

Name: Product Management Analyst
Description: Where good people build rewarding careers.  Think that working in the insurance field can't be exciting, rewarding and challenging? Think again. You'll help us reinvent protection and retirement to improve customers' lives. We'll help you make an impact with our training and mentoring offerings. Here, you'll have the opportunity to expand and apply your skills in ways you never thought possible. And you'll have fun doing it. Join a company of individuals with hopes, plans and passions, all using and developing our talents for good, at work and in life. Job Description Job Family Summary  The ADS Product Management team is responsible for the design, development and execution of new and existing F & I (Finance & Insurance) products, services or business models (i.e., financial structures) that drive growth, improve the customer experience, and deliver an acceptable return on investment Position Summary The Product Development Consultant provides support for new and existing product development activities using advanced technical skills to complete assignments that support business goals. The role is responsible for working with multifunctional teams in the design, analysis, and implementation of new products or product enhancements with activities including, but not limited to, projects, products or analytics.  Key Responsibilities Assists manager in prioritization of new and existing projectsLeads and contributes to projects that are moderate to large in scope and complexity using accepted project management standardsCompletes, tracks, and communicates progress and status of assigned tasks and projectsUtilizes the organizations product development process throughout all phases of new product and product enhancement projectsDemonstrates proficiency in building strong relationships among teams and team members to ensure cooperation on project objectivesIdentifies, develops and designs new plans, programs, processes, and productsLeads the integration and delivery of planned changes/ projects/ products to regions/fieldIdentifies product line process improvementsAssists manager in vendor management activitiesAssists in the development of processes and tools required to complete projects within scope, time, and cost constraintsCompletes ad hoc projects as assigned by manager Job Qualifications  Knowledge/Skills/Abilities/Experience Bachelor Degree required with business or analytical concentration preferred2-4 years industry experience with background in project management or product development preferredIntermediate to advanced proficiency in Excel, PowerPoint, WordIntermediate to advanced knowledge of industry and standard market specific implications of business strategiesIntermediate to advanced knowledge in the use of data sources and applications to conduct researchStrong written and verbal communication skillsSome formal training in project management or business process improvement Allstate Level Factors Please refer to the Allstate Level Guide on MyHR Knowledge  Regular, predictable attendance is an essential function of this job.  The candidate(s) offered this position will be required to submit to a background investigation, which includes a drug screen.  Good Work. Good Life. Good Hands.  As a Fortune 100 company and industry leader, we provide a competitive salary - but that's just the beginning. Our Total Rewards package also offers benefits like tuition assistance, medical and dental insurance, as well as a robust pension and 401(k). Plus, you'll have access to a wide variety of programs to help you balance your work and personal life -- including a generous paid time off policy.  Learn more about life at Allstate. Connect with us on Twitter, Facebook, Instagram and LinkedIn or watch a video.  Allstate generally does not sponsor individuals for employment-based visas for this position.  Effective July 1, 2014, under Indiana House Enrolled Act (HEA) 1242, it is against public policy of the State of Indiana and a discriminatory practice for an employer to discriminate against a prospective employee on the basis of status as a veteran by refusing to employ an applicant on the basis that they are a veteran of the armed forces of the United States, a member of the Indiana National Guard or a member of a reserve component. It is the policy of Allstate to employ the best qualified individuals available for all jobs without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity/gender expression, disability, and citizenship status as a veteran with a disability or veteran of the Vietnam Era.  Apply on Company Website  Job ID: US*1743_******  For your privacy and protection, when applying to a job online, never give your social security number to a prospective employer, provide credit card or bank account information, or perform any sort of monetary transaction. Learn more.  Allstate Insurance Company  The Allstate Corporation is the largest publicly held personal lines property and casualty insurer in America, serving more than 16 million households nationwide. Founded in 1931, Allstate has been dedicated to protecting our customers from life's uncertainties and preparing them for the future for more than 85 years. Allstate became a publicly traded company in 1993, and is listed on the New York Stock Exchange under the trading symbol ALL. As of year-end 2015, Allstate had nearly $104.7 billion in total assets. Name: Stat Programmer Analyst I
Description: City Jacksonville State Florida Telecommute No Department Health Sciences Research Position description Will utilize statistical knowledge, programming techniques, and workflow management skills in data management and analysis. Inquisitiveness, along with the ability to think logically and systematically to analyze and evaluate alternate solutions, is expected. Strong organizational and documentation skills, proven written and oral communication skills, and the ability to work both independently and in a team environment are essential. A basic knowledge of current medical developments, human physiology, or medical terminology is helpful. The minimum salary every 2 weeks is approx $1,987.20 based on a full-time position. A beautiful coastal Florida city that features excellent year-round climate, over 20 miles of beaches and outstanding outdoor recreational, cultural and family-oriented amenities. The "River City by the Sea" has an excellent school system, reasonable cost of living and a thriving business environment. Jacksonville continues to grow as more people relocate from all over the U.S. and abroad, to see what the great River City has to offer! Description: Job DescriptionJob Title: Global Office Support Analyst Job ID:******Location: Jacksonville Full/Part Time: Full-time Regular/Temporary: Permanent  Operations  Operations provides support for all of Deutsche Bank's businesses to enable them to deliver transactions and processes to clients. Our people work in established global financial centres such as London, New York, Frankfurt and Singapore, as well as specialist development and service centres in locations including Bucharest, Moscow, Pune, Dublin and Cary. We process payments in excess of a trillion euros across the bank's platforms, support thousands of trading desks and enable millions of banking transactions, share trades and emails every day.  A dynamic and diverse division, our objective is to make sure that all our services are executed in a timely and professional manner, that risk is minimised and that the client experience is positive. We are proud of the professionalism of our people, and the work they do. In return, we offer excellent career development opportunities to foster skills and talent. We serve our clients' real economic needs in commercial and investment banking, retail banking and transaction banking, and provide ground-breaking products and services in asset and wealth management. That means a career packed with opportunities to grow and the chance to shape the future of our clients. Name: IS033 - System Analyst
Description: At VyStar, we offer competitive pay, an excellent benefit package that includes a 401(k) Plan, an extensive paid technical and on-the-job training program, and tuition reimbursement--available to all full and part time employees. Part time positions start at a minimum of 30 hours per week.  We encourage you to become a part of VyStar Credit Union's family of employees.IS033 - System AnalystACCOUNTABILITY STATEMENT  Incumbents will assist in the support of a suite of application systems for key business areas through an understanding of system application knowledge and departmental business workflow. Position will provide specific application technical administration, and coordinate vendor support, maintenance and application upgrades. Incumbents will provide project support through the design phase of systems development lifecycle, assist in application configuration, and change control management for all supported applications.ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONSIncumbent is expected to demonstrate each of the following VyStar Excellence Behaviors in performing the duties and responsibilities of their job.Focus - Focus your full attention by carefully listening to and observing your client or member.Connect - Consistently be friendly and approachable. Demonstrate you care.Understand - Listen empathetically and ask questions. (70%/30%)Counsel - Recommend solutions based on your client’s or member’s needs and objectives.Advance - Ensure that member's expectations were exceeded.Analyzes and updates functional specifications for existing application systems supporting Credit Union business processes.Perform system configuration for existing application systems supporting Credit Union business processes, including but not limited to Cherwell information technology support system, CRIF lending application, mortgage origination system, FSBA teller application, Laserfiche workflows, and MISER.Develops an understanding of internal and/or external customer business requirements.Assists in the research and development of tactical and strategic system solutions for existing system performance issues.Provides 3rd tier problem resolution assistance for system deficiencies or errors and coordinates the prompt diagnosis and resolution of application system issues that have an impact on the production environment and document management of the Credit Union business departments. Coordinates with the application vendor/development team to resolve problems and trouble tickets. Maintains application performance and integrity during ongoing development, modification and support processes. Works directly with the vendor to obtain package application support.Works with business analysts to assist in development of departmental testing requirements for applications programs and coordinates completion of change management control processes related to the production and test environment. Investigates, implements, and maintains correction and lead recovery processes and activities for the application or data.Closely works with the business analysts in the development, testing and implementation of new applications, existing application upgrades and new application releases and participates in large group projects under the direction of an assigned Project Manager as appropriate. Works with analysts in maintenance support, report writing to support end-user requests, assists in change management controls of the production environment. Closely works with the Database Administrator building SQL scripts, maintaining application databases and recovery processes and activities for the application of data.There are periods when extended hours are required to meet deadlines, and when incumbent will be “on call” for system problems encountered at any time; 24 hour per day, 7 day per week.Performs other duties as assigned.JOB QUALIFICATIONSExperience Ability to read, analyze, interpret and apply common systems development requirements and design criteria. Understanding of structured Quality Assurance testing program development and ongoing process support for a systems environment.Computer SkillsTo perform this job successfully, an individual should have familiarity with standard MS Office software, desktop operating systems (Windows 2000/XP/Vista/Windows 7), server operating systems (Windows Server2003, Windows Server 2008) and MS SQL Server. Ability to use and understand network protocol is beneficial. Be familiar with standard application software development tools/techniques for web systems and the Java software programming language. Troubleshooting, logical flow of data translation and attention to detail are necessary skills.  Familiarity with standard application software development tools/techniques for client/server and mainframe platforms, PCs and other production system areas such as MS Project and/or Project Central project management software and Standard Client/Server database(s); and query tools such as Access and/or Crystal Reports. Be capable of performing application administration to system files, parameter settings, software configuration tables and database edits.EducationTwo-year college or university program certificate and two to four years related experience and/or training; or equivalent combination of education and significant relevant experience. DISCLAIMERS AND WORK ENVIRONMENT Nothing in this position description is an implied contract for employment. The position description is intended to be an accurate account of the essential functions. The functions are not all encompassing and are subject to change at any time by management.  The work environment characteristics described are representative of those that an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.  As required or requested, may exert up to 20 pounds of force occasionally and/or a negligible amount of force constantly to lift, carry, push, pull or otherwise move objects.

Name: Senior SOACC Intelligence Analyst
Description: Job Description: Bank of America is seeking a senior intelligence analyst on the Global Corporate Security Intelligence and Travel Security Analytics team, responsible for conducting analysis on the convergence of risks across regional and subject-matter (Geopolitical, Economic, Political Instability, Civil Unrest, Terrorism, Crime, etc.) lines as well as providing analytic guidance and mentorship to junior analysts and assisting management with time sensitive requests and ad-hoc projects and initiatives.  Collects, researches, and analyzes, risk, intelligence-related data and information derived from a variety of sources - to include input from various lines of business - to identify and evaluate patterns and trends indicative of potential risks to BofAML and assist Global Corporate Security leadership in risk mitigation. Works closely with regional analysts to drive the development of analytical products, verbal and written briefings, and communications that outline a well-rounded overview of a particular risk, event, trend, development. Responsible for identifying emerging risks, trends, events, developments common across various regions or convergence risks and leads the appropriate analytical reporting efforts, to ensure awareness across the enterprise. Develop partnerships with other risk functions and lines of business (LOBs) across the enterprise, to identify opportunities for collaboration or convergence risks/indicators.Work with management and key stakeholders to identify key priority risks/events/trends of interest/concern and develops a working understanding of the identified priority items/risksIdentify information gaps in terms of the teams understanding of the priority items/risks and recommend ways to amend information gapsAnticipate new, emerging risks through horizontal scanning; track leading indicators, complete scenario analysisFuse complex and disparate information to identify the convergence of risks or threats.Conduct predictive analysis on possible future events and potential impacts to decisions during an eventResearches, compiles, analyzes, and disseminates risk intelligence and informationResearch and draft content for convergence analysis and deep-dive assessment productsAssist supervisor with special projects and ad-hoc requests, as directedSupports analytical and regional security team during times of emergencies and other eventsServe as liaison to outside sources and entities to proactively receive and/or improve data streamsUnderstand the complexities of Bank of America operations and be able to communicate effectively across multiple LOBsWill serve in a rotating 'on-call' capacity to support real-time events. Required Skills Must have Bachelor's DegreeAt least five years of intelligence or risk experience; private sector experience is preferredAble to develop and maintain partnerships with internal/external entities for information sharing and event management.Must have proven track record in intelligence/fusion analysis field, such as previous experience with a federal, state, local, or private sector intelligence or law enforcement entity; demonstrated familiarity with the intelligence cycle (collection, analysis, and dissemination).Demonstrated experience with analytical tools and processes (ArcGIS, PowerPoint, Excel macros, pivot tables, V-lookups, linking tables); experience in research methods related to the social science discipline (quantitative, qualitative, and evaluation research).Superior research skills, including ability to quickly research and provide analysis on complex and unfamiliar topics.Superior writing skills with knowledge and understanding of intelligence analysis writing style (clear, effective, and brief)Professional demeanor.Strong interpersonal and communication skills (written and verbal); proven ability to interact with and effectively support a wide range of consumers, up to and including senior leaders; excellent briefing skills and ability to synthesize large volumes of data quickly for multiple customer sets.Proven ability to work independently with little to no direction; ability to juggle multiple tasks simultaneously, to assess and meet deadlines, and to collaborate with analysts based in other regions to produce value-added intelligence analysis; ability to balance direction from supervisors in multiple locations.Creative thinker, capable of spotting and forecasting emerging trends, risks, and tacticsProven business acumen and ability to leverage databases to input data and extract trends from them; expertise in using mapping software to portray security/risk/intelligence trends.Proven ability to operate efficiently and effectively in a high pressure time sensitive environment.Shift:1st shift (United States of America)Hours Per Week:40

Name: Application Analyst III
Description: Job DescriptionThe Application Analyst must have clear understanding of system(s) functionality and/or departmental processes as they relate to the supported system/application(s). Strong analytical, organizational and communication skills are required for interpreting and distributing documentation related to systems/application functionality, upgrades and enhancements. Devises or modifies procedures to solve complex problems considering systems limitations. May be responsible for multiple phases of a project. Duties include instructing, directing and checking the work of others. Must be able to work both independently and as a team member in a solution-oriented, customer-focused environment.  Essential Functions Originating action to improve existing conditions and processes; identifying improvement opportunities, generating ideas, and implementing solutions.Identifies opportunities by reviewing processes to determine any gaps between current outputs and expected requirements.Determines causes by identifying conditions that contribute to gaps or key variances; explores relationships between conditions and outcomes; distinguishes causes from symptoms and identifies primary causes.Targets improvement ideas to generate ideas for solutions; analyzes the potential effect or impact of each solution; selects appropriate solutions.Implements improvements by tests solutions; gathers feedback on effectiveness; reviews impact on baseline measures; modifies solutions as appropriate to ensure effectiveness.Continuous learning by actively identifying new areas for learning; regularly creating and taking advantage of learning opportunities; using newly gained knowledge and skill on the job and learning through their application. Seeks learning activities and identifies and participates in appropriate learning activities (e.g., courses, reading, self-study, coaching, and experiential learning) that help fulfill learning needs.Puts new knowledge, understanding or skill to practical use on the job; furthers learning through trial and error. Takes risks in learning by putting self in unfamiliar or uncomfortable situation in order to learn; asks questions at the risk of appearing foolish; takes on challenging or unfamiliar assignments.Clarifies customer interests by having a full understanding of customers' wants, desires, problems, concerns, satisfactions, and expectations by seeking or confirming information and opinions during the implementation of sales contracts and throughout the relationship.Responds quickly to resolve customer problems and concerns; keeps customers informed and provides feedback on actions taken; initiates appropriate actions based upon customer or team input.Facilitates goal accomplishment by suggested procedural or process suggestions for achieving team goals or performing team functions; provides necessary resources or helps to remove obstacles to help the team accomplish its goals.Team commitment to listen and fully involves others in team decisions and actions; values and uses individual differences and talents. Informs others on team by sharing important or relevant information with the team. Models commitment by adhering to the team's expectations and guidelines; fulfills team responsibilities; demonstrates personal commitment to the team. Performs other duties as assigned.  Maintaining effectiveness when experiencing major changes in work responsibilities or environment; adjusting effectively to work within new work structures, processes, requirements or cultures. Tries to understand changes by actively seeks information about new work situations; strives to understand the rationale and implications for changes in work responsibilities or environment.  Approaches change or newness positively and treats change and new situations as opportunities for learning or growth; identifies the benefits of change; speaks positively about the change to others.  Quickly modifies behavior to deal effectively with changes in the work environment; tries new approaches appropriate for new or changed situations; does not persist with ineffective behaviors.Job RequirementsSuperior customer service skills.  Ability to test and evaluate computer software functions.  Must be knowledgeable in maintenance and troubleshooting procedures using advanced troubleshooting skills.  Relies on experience and judgment to plan and accomplish goals.  A wide degree of creativity and latitude is expected.  Excellent oral and written communication skills at technical and non-technical levels.  Excellent time management and multitasking skills.  Attention to detail and quality of work.  The drive and ability to see problems through to completion.  Ability to manage stressful situations in a calm, courteous and efficient manner.  Ability to exercise good judgment, prioritize multiple tasks, and problem solve under pressure of deadlines.  Strong workflow and data flow analysis skills, strong problem solving skills and able to acquire a working knowledge of departmental operations.  Experience with customizing build to user specifications  Must be able to work in a fast paced environment.  Minimum of four - six years appropriate experience.  Extensive experience with Microsoft office products.  Experience in the healthcare industry preferred related to computerized physician AR, Scheduling or Other Billing/Management Systems  Experience in the healthcare industry  Experience with computerized physician AR, scheduling or other related medical billing/management systems AND/OR electronic health record preferred.  High School Graduate or GED equivalent required.  Associates Degree or two years specialized training in an applicable field (Business Administration, Allied Health, Computer Science, etc.) preferred.  College course work and/or technical training may substitute for a portion of the required experience.  Applicable EPIC certification required or must be obtain within 8 months of employment.  Epic Certification(s) and/or New Version Training (NVTs) updates are required based on position and must pass required EPIC Certification(s) within three (3) attempts to maintain employment.  This applies to newly certified and/or required Epic re-certification process.  UFJPI is a Equal Opportunity Institution # of Hires Needed 1

Name: Lead Financial Analyst
Description: When the global aerospace community looks for ideas and solutions to its biggest challenges, they turn to the people of UTC Aerospace Systems. We design, invent and deliver the most advanced and diverse range of aerospace systems on the market. We are inventors. We are manufacturers. We work in space exploration, commercial air travel, defense and rescue applications. Always learning and pushing the boundaries, we are an undisputed industry leader that continually sets the bar higher and higher. Come soar with us.You probably never think about it, but the engines on an aircraft need to be housed in safe, aerodynamic structures called “nacelles.” UTC Aerospace Systems’ Aerostructures business is a world leader in nacelle technology, which leads to better fuel efficiency, less engine noise and critical stopping power when the airplane lands. Today, our innovative nacelle systems are featured on many of the world’s newest and most game-changing airplane platforms. And we’re not stopping there: we’re working hard to create the next generation of nacelles that are greener, quieter and more efficient. In addition, our Engineered Polymer Products division is a leading developer and manufacturer of advanced, high-performance composite structures and products for marine applications. Whether in the air or underwater, we’re pushing the limits of innovation. Want to join us on this important journey?Want to be part of a finance team where every day is unique and exciting? Are you ready to analyze a diverse set of products that really make a difference? If so, then UTC Aerospace Systems is the place for you! By joining us, you’ll have the opportunity to support thousands of aerospace, defense and space systems across more than 150 sites in 26 countries. Additionally, as UTC Aerospace Systems is a subsidiary of United Technologies Corporation (Fortune 50), it operates as its own business with its own reporting structure, financial dashboards and earnings metrics. This reporting relationship allows finance team members to implement innovative tools for the aerospace market in a stand-alone business environment. If you want to advance your career while contributing to a mission that truly makes a difference to modern flight and space advancements, then this team is right for you!As Lead Financial Analyst for UTC's Engineered Polymer Products business, you will apply cost accounting principles to analyze financial information, prepare financial reports including month end close responsibilities and participate in continuous operational improvements.You will also be responsible for key accounting functions, development of latest financial estimates, financial planning, variance to actual analysis, and as well as being a key financial advisor to the business and its constituents. This position is the acting lead in cost accounting and forecasting and will require a keen understanding of U.S. GAAP.Responsibilities include, but are not limited to: -Primary Responsibilities Provide support for proper revenue recognition. Lead and ensure a timely and accurate monthly and quarterly financial close to include accurate and on-time delivery of all business unit deliverables. Preparation and review of monthly and quarterly account reconciliationsPreparation, oversight and review of FP&A-related monthly forecasts and performance, annual business plans, overhead budgets and LE (Latest Estimate) updates. Support monthly financial close and weekly operational performance reviews by articulating the “story” implied by the analytical findings Provides financial and cost reporting in support of high visibility metrics such as senior leadership business reviews.Perform site forecasting; budgeting and long-range planning functions in conjunction with the site Controller. Partners with program and senior leadership in support of long-term financial strategy by constructing and analyzing financial models for various projects. Ensure 100 percent compliance with all financial and business controls and adherence to all Sarbanes-Oxley requirements including documentation and testing of business controls; Government accounting requirements, DCMA / DCAA audits and reporting requirements, and UTC internal audits. Formulates and leads process/system improvements through Continuous Improvement events, introducing new methods and approaches, establishing best practices, and managing standard work. May be asked to lead a project team, or multiple smaller project teams, or leads a functional team, or unit in area of expertise. In this role, you will be required to ...Work independently and in teams; take initiative to identify opportunities for process improvements and resolve issues while working and communicating effectively with all levels of the organization.Be proficient and comfortable working with large sets of data and performing data miningBe a true self-starter, with the ability to manage concurrent assignments and function in time sensitive situations.Qualification: Basic Qualifications4+ years of accounting / finance experience which includes comprehensive financial statement and cash flow statement analysis including ...Extensive use of ERP systems such as SAP, Oracle, etc., andVery Strong Microsoft Excel skills, including charts, pivot tables, analytics, with ability to diagnose and reverse- engineer formulas and filesExcellent communication and presentation skills with ability to explain program complexities.Strong analytical and organizational skills; detailed orientated individual with a strong focus on achieving results.Preferred QualificationsSTRONG PREFERENCE for extensive Cost Accounting in a manufacturing environmentExperience with SAP and Hyperion Financial ManagementExperience with the SAP Business Intelligence suite (Business Objects, BEx Query Designer)Understanding of government accounting: FAR, DFARS, CASTechnical Accounting experience also preferredEducation: Bachelor's in Accounting or Finance requiredMaster's degree and CPA or CPA track preferredNothing matters more to UTC Aerospace Systems than our strong ethical and safety commitments. Therefore, all U.S. positions require a background check, which may include a drug screen.UTAS4220182United Technologies Corporation is An Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or veteran status, age or any other federally protected class.

Name: GWIM Sr Operations Analyst
Description: Job Description:Enterprise Job Description Provides technical and analytical support in a GWIM operations function for one or more product areas such as funds transfer, collateral mg.t/margins, corporate actions, static data/data management, control, trader support, clearance/settlement, documentation/confirmations, customer service, new accounts, client valuations, document processing or statement/billing processing. Responsible for the analysis and resolution of moderately complex operations problems and initiatives requiring exception handling and working with multiple operational and/or product specialists to resolve. May participate in projects and/or introduction of new initiatives, systems, products/services and processes. As a technical expert, acts as a unit advisor providing technical support to less experienced associates. This role typically requires 3+ years' experience in operations functions and a thorough working knowledge of the operational aspects of transactions and products. Line of Business Position Description and Responsibilities: The position is located in Boston and within the U.S Trust Investment Services group. The Trade Support Analyst will work with various custodian banks and brokers and provide technical operational trade support for U.S. Trust. The Analyst will be responsible for the timely and accurate delivery and settlement of both Equity and Fixed Income security transactions. The Analyst will provide high quality customer service, product knowledge, and problem resolution. The candidate must be able converse intelligently with the front office and will deal regularly with portfolio managers, traders and various technology teams.  Responsibilities include:  The matching and affirmation of Equity and/or Fixed Income security transactions  Reporting trades to custodian banks, manually or systematically  Following up on all exceptions with appropriate parties (trading, custodian banks, brokers and fund accounting)  Developing and maintaining positive relationships with all internal and external contacts to promote expeditious trade problem resolution  Ensuring all SLAs for Trade Support have been adhered to  Ensuring that all issues are escalated to the appropriate levels in a timely fashion  Ensuring compliance to all levels of audit  Completing projects (industry or regulatory) assigned by Department Manager or Team Lead Required Skills and Experience:Minimum of 2 years experience in an investment operations role or equivalentDesired Skills and Experience:Bachelor's degree in Finance, Accounting, Economics or equivalentExperience on both domestic and international trade marketsMaintain effective working relationships with both internal and external partiesGood understanding of equity, fixed income and cash investmentsDemonstrates thoroughness and accuracy in work completedGood organizational and time management skillsStrong verbal and written communication skillsExtremely detail orientedAbility to work under pressure with changing work requirementsTeam player that is able to learn other operationsHigh personal standards of conduct and integrityBasic Bloomberg experience a plusExperience with Charles River, OMGEO, CTM, Oasys, PACE, TradeWeb, MarketAxess a plusShift:1st shift (United States of America)Hours Per Week:40

Name: Financial Analyst II
Description: Job ID: 18006881 Company Name: TIAA Bank Description: PRIMARY CHARACTERISTICS This position is responsible for timely and accurate forecasting and modeling, preparing reporting packages and performing complex analysis of financial activities. Name: PMO, Senior Program Analyst
Description: PMO, Senior Program AnalystCareers That Change LivesWe value what makes you unique. Be a part of a company that thinks differently to solve problems, make progress, and deliver meaningful innovations.In support of new product development in Medtronic’s Restorative Therapies Division, the Program Management Office ensures that product development teams are operating with cross-functionally integrated program plans to achieve our business metrics of new products to market on time, on budget. The Program Management Office for the ENT, Enabling Technologies, and CSF Management business sector supports new product development in five locations across the United States: · Jacksonville, FL· Littleton, MA· Fort Worth, TX· Louisville, CO· Goleta, CAAs a Senior Program Analyst for the sector Project Management Office you will deliver on the defined strategy for metrics and data management, producing and automating dashboards, as well as integrating multiple databases containing finance, schedule, resource, and associated business data. In addition, in this role you will assist in developing a Real Time Compliance Assessment Process, as well as updating and maintaining an internal Knowledge Repository.You will be an essential member of the Research and Development maturity strategy to improve access and visibility to program data for decision-making and improve information sharing across the sector. Understanding matrix working relationships with program leadership and ensuring strong partnerships and consistency in reporting across all business units is critical as well as strong relationships with Program Managers, Program Analysts, Finance and Functional partners.A Day in the Life· You will design, establish and maintain standard processes and templates to manage data from multiple sources· You will advise and define process-improvement opportunities for visualization and reporting of KPI’s· You will maintain clear and consistent metrics and scorecards across all key performance indicators (KPI’s)· You will create, consolidate and communicate detailed reports and key data to stakeholders· You will work with Program Managers to support analytics-driven decision making based on data· You will maintain and own continuous improvement for scorecards and dashboards that present relevant data tailored to Program Managers and Business Unit LeadershipMust Have: Minimum Requirements You will have a Bachelors’ degree in Engineering, IT, Business or technical field and 4+ years experience or an advanced degree and 2+ years experienceNice to Have§ PMP certification§ Program Management experience in a complex matrixed organization§ Program metrics migration from legacy systems to new, cloud-based framework§ User-interface design experience; Reporting/Dashboarding design experience§ Lean six sigma or DFSS Green Belt§ Data analytics, risk management and financial competenceAbout MedtronicTogether, we can change healthcare worldwide. At Medtronic, we push the limits of what technology, therapies and services can do to help alleviate pain, restore health and extend life. We challenge ourselves and each other to make tomorrow better than yesterday. It is what makes this an exciting and rewarding place to be. We want to accelerate and advance our ability to create meaningful innovations - but we will only succeed with the right people on our team. Let’s work together to address universal healthcare needs and improve patients’ lives. Help us shape the future. Physical Job RequirementsThe above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by employees assigned to this position, but they are not an exhaustive list of all the required responsibilities and skills of this position. The physical demands described within the Day in the Life section of this job description are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Name: Reporting Group Operations Analyst
Description: Job Title: Reporting Group Operations Analyst Job ID:****** Location: Jacksonville Full/Part Time: Full-time Regular/Temporary: Permanent  Return to Previous Page  Operations  Operations provides support for all of Deutsche Bank's businesses to enable them to deliver transactions and processes to clients. Our people work in established global financial centres such as London, New York, Frankfurt and Singapore, as well as specialist development and service centres in locations including Bucharest, Moscow, Pune, Dublin and Cary. We process payments in excess of a trillion euros across the bank's platforms, support thousands of trading desks and enable millions of banking transactions, share trades and emails every day.  A dynamic and diverse division, our objective is to make sure that all our services are executed in a timely and professional manner, that risk is minimised and that the client experience is positive. We are proud of the professionalism of our people, and the work they do. In return, we offer excellent career development opportunities to foster skills and talent.  Job Title: Reporting Group Operations Analyst  Location: Jacksonville, FL  About Deutsche Bank  We are Germany's leading bank with strong positions in Europe and significant presence in the Americas and Asia Pacific. We're driving growth through our strong client franchise, investing heavily in digital technologies, prioritizing long-term success over short-term gains, and serving society with ambition and integrity. We serve our clients' real economic needs in commercial and investment banking, retail banking and transaction banking, and provide ground-breaking products and services in asset and wealth management. That means a career packed with opportunities to grow and the chance to shape the future of our clients.  Role Description/Summary  The US Corporate Trust Operations Reporting Group Operations Analyst (OA) is responsible for the day to day operational aspects of regulatory reporting and escheatment. This position entails preparation of regulatory reports and coordination of the Bank's seasonal state escheatment cycles. Daily responsibilities will include compliance with US Federal reporting regulations and state escheatment regulations, both internal and external client contact, monitoring of a group email box, and identified issue escalation to management.  Role Specific Responsibilities/Tasks  As a Reporting Group Operations Analyst your responsibilities will be primarily, but not limited to the following:  Preparing regulatory reports including the TIC SLT, Form S, BL-2, and TA-2  Respond to Deutsche Bank Finance inquiries regarding questions on Treasury reporting  Understands the business environment to help quickly identify potential issues derived from Operations that will affect the regulatory environment  Responding to customer inquiries and update and/or write procedures as needed  Plan and deliver on project deadlines  Communicate effectively with other members of Deutsche Bank both verbally and through email  Perform work in an accurate and timely manner with appropriate supervision  Conduct research and resolution of historical transactions and proof reconciliations  Ability to adjust to procedural changes in a dynamic processing environment  Basic understanding of project management  The ability to problem solve with minimal supervision  Ability to work as a team in a diverse environment  Basic computer literacy including at least mid-level proficiency in MS Excel, Word, and PowerPoint  Operations Analyst Responsibilities/Tasks  As an Operations Analyst with Deutsche Bank your responsibilities include:  Responsible for ensuring timely, complete and accurate processing of transactions (including performing all relevant controls) within own area of responsibility  Applies all internal and external policies/guidelines and requirements of the regulators and to agreed SLAs, KRIs and/or KPIs and quality measures  Provides input, as appropriate, to product / function development to ensure a superior offering in the face of changing client needs and market trends  Ensures the escalation of operational, regulatory and other risks to line manager and functional leads as appropriate; contributes to the development and implementation of mitigation or control solutions  Uses knowledge and experience from own area of responsibility to inform the design and implementation of strategies to eliminate waste and improve efficiency and performance of existing processes and reports  Works effectively within own team, providing support and guidance to colleagues to create and foster an environment of continuous improvement Operations Analyst Experience/Exposure: Basic analytical skills, flexible regarding production problem solving  Excellent communication skills, fluent in English and local language (written/verbal) as appropriate  Ability to work in virtual teams and in a matrix organizations  Excellent team worker, able to work in virtual global teams and a matrix organization  Ability to work in fast paced environment, keep pace with technical innovation and maintain a broad understanding of the product offering  Open minded, able to share information, transfer knowledge and expertise to team members Education/Certification: Bachelor Degree from an accredited college or university (or equivalent)  Competencies/Proficiency Level Business: Business Strategy-P1 - Aware  Financial Management-P1 - Aware  Industry Knowledge-P1 - Aware  Product Knowledge (internal & external)-P2 - Basic  Risk Management-P1 - Aware Technical: Business Analysis-P2 - Basic  Client Services-P1 - Aware  Operational Management-P1 - Aware  Quality Management-P2 - Basic  Operational Processing-P2 - Basic  For candidates applying for positions in the US:  Deutsche Bank is an Equal Opportunity Employer - Veterans/Disabled and other protected categories. Click these links to view the EEO is the Law poster and pay transparency statement.

Name: Program Planning and Control Sr. Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionRESPONSIBILITIES: Analyze cost trends in order to correct errors and provide forward guidance to maximize revenue and profit and minimize cost variances.  Develop and control baselines and budgets.  Monitor schedule/milestones to facilitate estimates to complete and process scope changes.  Prepare and deliver customer report deliverables per the contract terms and conditions.  Analyze/modify cost estimates and re-baseline programs as the need is identified.  . Prepare forecasts using program resource estimates with appropriately applied rates and factors.  . Develop price/cost estimates utilizing complex pricing concepts and applications.  . Application of FAR, CAS and government accounting standards.  . Develop Work Breakdown Structure (WBS), perform maintenance and charge number control.  . Perform complex accounting and analytical tasks, including transaction processing, account reconciliation and analysis.  . Analyze program funding requirements and track subcontractor costs & fee.  . Develop presentations and reports for internal and external customers.  . Track, trend, forecast and analyze subcontractor and vendor invoices.  . Demonstrate a high level of customer focus during frequent interaction with internal and external customers.  . Lead process improvement initiatives within the Finance group.  . Coordinate and lead cross functional teams to establish decision options.  . Recognize need and provide mentoring and training.  . Develop and carry out long- and short-term objectives and balance multiple priorities.  . Identify, diagnose and resolve complex problems independently.  . Perform all other duties as assigned  REQUIRED EXPERIENCE:  . Mastery of complex program management concepts (budgets, estimate to complete, project schedules, etc.).  . Mastery of project management scheduling and control account planning concepts.  . Excellent written, verbal and interpersonal communication skills.  . Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite. Highly advanced  Preferred DelTek experience. Preferred CostPoint 6 & Excel skills.  EDUCATION: Accredited Bachelor's degree in Business, Finance, Accounting or related field and 5-10 years minimum related experience.  MISC:  Opportunity for contract-to-hire based on worker performance, worker attendance and dependability and client business needs  WORK HOURS:  Full-Time/First ShiftCompany DescriptionChipton Ross, a leader in staffing Technical Engineering, Information Technology (IT), Industrial, Professional, and Administrative career opportunities throughout the United States. (Now offering a Logistics Recruiting Division.)  Visit our web site @ http://www.chiptonross.com/ to get details on over 2500 job openings in 28 states.

Name: Electronic Communications Reviewer - Analyst
Description: Job Title: Electronic Communications Reviewer - Analyst Job ID:****** Location: Jacksonville Full/Part Time: Full-time Regular/Temporary: Permanent  Return to Previous Page  DWS Group GmbH & Co. KGaA (DWS) is one of the world's leading asset managers with EUR 700bn of assets under management (as of 31 Dec 2017). Building on more than 60 years of experience and a reputation for excellence in Germany and across Europe, DWS has come to be recognized by clients globally as a trusted source for integrated investment solutions, stability and innovation across a full spectrum of investment disciplines.  We offer individuals and institutions access to our strong investment capabilities across all major asset classes and solutions aligned to growth trends. Our diverse expertise in Active, Passive and Alternatives asset management - as well as our deep environmental, social and governance focus - complement each other when creating targeted solutions for our clients. Name: IS079 - System Analyst Lead
Description: At VyStar, we offer competitive pay, an excellent benefit package that includes a 401(k) Plan, an extensive paid technical and on-the-job training program, and tuition reimbursement--available to all full and part time employees. Part time positions start at a minimum of 30 hours per week.  We encourage you to become a part of VyStar Credit Union's family of employees.IS079 - System Analyst LeadESSENTIAL JOB DUTIES Analyzes, develops, and writes functional specifications for complex application systems supporting Credit Union business processes. Researches and analyzes application systems to develop an understanding of internal and/or external customer business requirements.Assists in the research and development of tactical and strategic system solutions for existing system performance issues as well as applications for new systems. Evaluates business requirements and proposes optimal solution (\"buy or build\"). Discusses and evaluates new proposals with the business departments.Provides application problem resolution assistance for system deficiencies or errors and coordinates the prompt diagnosis and resolution of application system issues that have an impact on the production environment and document management of the Credit Union business departments.Coordinate with the application vendor and development teams to resolve problems and trouble tickets. Maintains application performance and integrity during ongoing development, modification and support processes. Works directly with the vendor to obtain technical application support.Performs maintenance support and report writing to support end-user requests. Develops testing requirements for applications programs and assists in change management controls of the production environment. Investigates, implements, and maintains correction and lead recovery processes and activities for the application or data.Participates in and will lead project teams for requirements gathering, scope document authoring, development, testing and implementation of new applications and interfaces, existing application upgrades and new application release upgrades.To perform as a team leader and assist in the cross-training of application and interfaces with department peers.Performs other duties as assigned.Demonstrate each of the following VyStar Excellence behaviors in performing the duties and responsibilities of their job. o Focus – Focus your full attention by carefully listening to and observing your clients or member.  o Connect – Consistently be friendly and approachable. Demonstrate you care.  o Understand – Listen empathetically and ask questions (70% to 30%).  o Counsel – Recommend solutions based on your client’s or member’s needs and objectives.  o Advance – Ensure that member’s or client’s expectations were exceeded.  o Verify necessary follow-up actions were completed. JOB KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS & ABILITIESRequired: Previous supervisory and management experience desired. In-depth working knowledge of software applications development principles, Microsoft operating systems, and Office applications are required. Candidate must have experience analyzing business processes and creating flow, models and diagrams in support of software development and process improvement efforts. Experience with host financial system software and project management is a plus.  A high level of analytic ability is required. Independent judgment is required. Candidate will be overseeing the performance of junior level system analysts and leading large-scale project implementations. Candidate must possess the ability to read, analyze, interpret and apply common software and system development requirements into functional design documents. Be capable of performing application administration to system files, parameter settings, software configuration tables and database edits.  A high level of interpersonal skills and social sensitivity are required. The candidate comes into contact with employees on all levels of the organization during the system requirement, evaluation, and maintenance of software applications and system. The candidate is a resource to the organization in software problem resolution and must be an effective listener and communicator. The candidate must set the example for subordinates in attitude, behavior, and work ethic. The candidate must set the example for subordinates in attitude, behavior, and work ethic.  The candidate will be required to participate in periodic counseling reports and performance appraisals on assigned personnel. EDUCATIONRequired: Position requires a Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Management Information Systems (MIS) or other Information Systems related technical field and a minimum of 7 years’ experience in application development, and support. Preferred: Additional years of related experience in the field may be substituted for formal education. DISCLAIMERS AND WORK ENVIRONMENT Nothing in this position description is an implied contract for employment. The position description is intended to be an accurate account of the essential functions. The functions are not all encompassing and are subject to change at any time by management.  The work environment characteristics described are representative of those that an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.  As required or requested, may exert up to 20 pounds of force occasionally and/or a negligible amount of force constantly to lift, carry, push, pull or otherwise move objects.

Conduct data analysis including competitive analysis, category performance, item level forecasting and pre/post-promotional analysis to understand business issues and opportunities within the category. Align pricing strategies to meet objectives of broader category and business strategy.4. Mentors and trains Pricing Analysts and Pricing Specialists. Lead continuous improvement and training of key functional processes.5. Ability to set priorities, plan and coordinate work activities and manage time and resources to accomplish work objectives on time. Excellent communication skills both verbal and written including the ability to address diverse audiences in a clear and concise manner.Results-oriented with ability to maintain a high level of work activity under a variety of conditions. Ability to maintain the highest level of confidentiality. Strong interpersonal skills with experience in relationship building and conflict resolution to develop and maintain positive working relationships with peers, management, suppliers and other company departments. Experience utilizing teamwork skills to create and maintain a cooperative work environment and resolve conflicts. Ability to persuade internal and external customers to commit to specific courses of action.Knowledge, Skills & Abilities Preferred:Proven experience with pricing systems and tools. Experience with process development and continuous improvement. The employee is occassionally (1-33%) required to stand or walk on carpet, tile or concrete, carry, push, lift or pull up to 10 lbs.Working Conditions:While performing the essential functions of this position, the employee is typically not substantially exposed to adverse working conditions.Safety Risk Factors:The employee is occassionally (1-33%) required to twist back and/or neck and walk on a slippery or cluttered floor surface.Equipment, Tools, etc.:While performing the essential functions of this position, the employee will be required to utilize a personal computer, telephone, printer, copy machine, facsimile machine and other general office supplies and equipment.Schedule(s):Varied schedules.Travel Percent:40%Overnight:Yes

Name: Control Room Analyst
Description: Job Title: Control Room Analyst Job ID:****** Location: Jacksonville Full/Part Time: Full-time Regular/Temporary: Permanent  Return to Previous Page  Regulation, Compliance & Anti-Financial Crime  Regulation, Compliance and Anti-Financial Crime (AFC) protects the integrity and reputation of Deutsche Bank. It manages the Bank's risks and help to avert unintentional rule breaches and conflicts of interest. At the same time, we also advise the bank on ethical conduct and governance issues and keep the bank up to date on regulatory and political challenges.  Job Title: Control Room Analyst  Corporate Title: Analyst  Location: Jacksonville, FL  About Deutsche Bank  We are Germany's leading bank with strong positions in Europe and significant presence in the Americas and Asia Pacific. We're driving growth through our strong client franchise, investing heavily in digital technologies, prioritizing long-term success over short-term gains, and serving society with ambition and integrity. We serve our clients' real economic needs in commercial and investment banking, retail banking and transaction banking, and provide ground-breaking products and services in asset and wealth management. That means a career packed with opportunities to grow and the chance to shape the future of our clients.  Department  The Compliance Department protects the Bank by advising on ethical conduct, identifying regulatory solutions, safeguarding integrity and reputation, and promoting, in partnership with the business, a culture of Compliance. Given the increasing regulatory scrutiny and the need to implement a robust and globally consistent control framework, an effective information barrier within the firm is a key component to the Department's success.  Overview  Compliance is seeking an Analyst within the Control Room function to monitor the integrity of the firm's information barriers, depending on level of experience. The primary function of the role is to maintain Deutsche Bank's Watch and Restricted lists, assist the business identify and mitigate any potential conflicts of interest, review research reports to ensure compliance with applicable securities laws, facilitate wall crossings and provide advice and guidance on the handling of confidential and price sensitive information. The role will also require learning rules and regulations pertaining to business communications between research analysts and investment bankers, and conducting further monitoring of those interactions to ensure compliance. Key Responsibilities: Maintenance of the firm's Watch and Restricted List  Evaluate and approve wall crossing requests  Review and clearance of Research for publication  Perform cross-divisional conflict checks and identify potential issues  Provide advice and guidance on legal, regulatory and compliance requirements as they relate to information barriers, conflicts of interest, offering rules, trade restrictions, and research  Assist in the development, review and testing of Control Room systems  Conduct ad-hoc projects  Monitor changes in securities regulations and implement or update applicable policies and procedures  Give advice and explanations regarding the above topics  Some weekend work may be required You will have: Bachelor's degree required; JD also considered  Relevant industry exposure or professional experience  Knowledge/background in investment banking products and application to the core Control Room functions, including confidential information, information barrier procedures and controls and insider trading rules  Knowledge/experience with financial markets and an array of financial products (including stocks, bonds, equity/credit derivatives)  Understanding of basic securities laws relating to research and insider trading rules Skills: Analytical, process-oriented mindset  Strong attention to detail, coupled with strong problem solving skills  A pro-active, results-oriented approach with strong drive and initiative  Well-developed relationship-building skills, networking skills and communication/influencing skills  Communication skills including confidence in expressing business views tactfully  Ability to manage multiple, deadline-oriented tasks in a fast paced environment  Microsoft Office Suite, especially ability to understand and manipulate Excel worksheets  Team work skills  For candidates applying for positions in the US:  Deutsche Bank is an Equal Opportunity Employer - Veterans/Disabled and other protected categories.
