Name: SOX Financial Analyst II
Description: Job ID: 18006884 Company Name: TIAA Bank Description: PRIMARY CHARACTERISTICS The Primary responsibility of this position is to assist in the internal control over financial reporting (ICFR) assessment of a set of assigned Bank business processes and assess the design and operating effectiveness of the key controls indentified within the assigned processes in compliance with FDICIA. This position will partner with the business areas, internal controls Project Management Office, and external and internal auditors as needed to ensure all in-scope processes, risk and controls are properly documented and evaluated. ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONSAssist in analyzing and reviewing assigned processes, risks and controls to ensure key risks and key controls have been identified and there are no gaps.Participate in design meetings and control walkthroughs to evaluate and document design effectiveness of the key controls.Assist in updating test plans and testing the operating effectiveness of key controls at interim, year-end and remediation testing.Ensure proper documentation of completed ICFR assessment.Identify control deficiencies and communicate the deficiency to the Finance Management, the business areas and the ICU PMO. This includes drafting the issue document.Assist the business areas with developing a remediation action plan for issues identified.Coordinate test samples and meetings with external and internal auditors to minimize duplicate work on the business areas and ensure the external auditors have what they need to complete their testing.KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES REQUIREMENTSGeneral understanding of financial/operational reporting, auditing concepts and practicesFamiliar with SOX requirements and conceptsStrong spreadsheet and analytical skillsStrong interpersonal skillsAbility to work with minimal supervision in a fast-paced, growth environmentStrong written and verbal communication skillsGood organizational and problem solving skills with attention to detailDetailed orientedSelf-starterProficient with Microsoft Office products (Excel, Word, Outlook; Visio preferred)Pro-activeTeam PlayerAbility to multi-taskTRAINING AND EXPERIENCEBachelor's degree required in Accounting, Finance or related business area4-6 years accounting, audit or financial services industry experienceBanking and/or mortgage industry experience preferredExperience with Generally Accepted Accounting Principles (GAAP), Generally Accepted Auditing Standards (GAAS), and OCC/FDICIA preferred.Possess or pursuing accounting or audit-specific certifications, such as Certified Public Accountant (CPA), or Certified Fraud Examiner (CFE) or Certified Internal Auditor (CIA), desirable but not requiredPre-Employment Screening May Include:Credit CheckCriminal Background CheckFingerprintingDMV CheckPast Employment VerificationSocial Security Verification Note: The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by people assigned to this job. Name: Analyst, Pricing
Description: Overview  Job Title: Analyst, Pricing  Location:Store Support Center  Position OverviewThe analyst, pricing, is responsible for the execution of strategic and tactical pricing initiatives within multiple categories. This position will support the pricing management team with the planning, development and implementation of pricing activities.Primary Responsibilities & Accountabilities Monitor monthly competitive price checks and identify competitive moves within the price zones and any trends impacting the category and/or the overall company pricing position.Create reports to analyze category pricing rules, identify trends related to the performance of the category and work with the pricing management team to recommend tactics to reach the goals of the category.Process all new items and discontinued items within assigned categories on a timely basis; verify pricing attributes are correct, determine if a price association code is necessary and communicate with data integrity any adjustments or corrections to the item prior to maintenance pulling to the stores.Conduct data analysis including competitive analysis, category performance, item level forecasting and pre/post-promotional analysis.Provide back-up assistance for data entry into the pricing systems to meet specified system deadlines.Evaluate held retails monthly and provide detailed analysis of items that need to be reviewed with the business unit to increase the deal rate or remove completely.Assist with the development and compilation of documentation needed to prepare pricing management for upcoming category business reviews.Visit stores with management to review current category pricing strategies, own brand relationships and gaps, competitive pricing strategies and promotional activity.Visit local competitors to collect retail information necessary to assist the business units with selecting the best promotional price for dependable deals and other long-term TPR's bi-monthly with the manager and/or director, category, to review current store conditions and category schematics to ensure proper space allocation and labor needs.Perform other job-related duties as assigned. Minimum QualificationsMinimum Bachelor's degree in business administration or related field and two (2) years of retail analytical experience; or an equivalent combination of education and experience.Ability to read, write and speak English proficiently.Ability to understand and follow English instructions.Authorization to work in the United States or the ability to obtain the same.Successful completion of pre-employment drug testing and background check. Required Behaviors Lives the Values by embracing the essence of the company demonstrating a commitment to the company's goal and values.Unifies and motivates team through praise and recognition of success with immediate feedback to build an environment of trust.Business-driven showing passion for the business, delivering results consistently.Customer-orientated by passionately demonstrating that the customer comes first always by putting the customer's needs above all else.People Passion through consistently treating others with respect and dignity. Knowledge, Skills, Abilities Compliance with all company policies and procedures.Ability to travel up to 25% of the time, including overnight.Demonstrated strong PC skills including working knowledge and proficiency with the primary Microsoft Office applications with a particular emphasis on Excel and other advanced data management techniques.Problem solving skills, including problem analysis, decision making, creativity and innovation.Proven ability to interpret data and express the implications of analyses.Ability to set priorities, plan and coordinate work activities and manage time and resources to accomplish work objectives on time.Strong interpersonal skills with experience in relationship building and conflict resolution to develop and maintain positive working relationships with peers, management, suppliers and other company departments.Excellent communication skills both verbal and written including the ability to address diverse audiences in a clear and concise manner.Results-oriented with ability to maintain a high level of work activity under a variety of conditions.Experience utilizing teamwork skills to create and maintain a cooperative work environment and resolve conflicts.Ability to persuade internal and external customers to commit to specific courses of action.Ability to maintain the highest level of confidentiality.SDL2017

requests into technical details, and ensuring deliverable commitments are met  Work directly with clients, leadership, and outside parties to research and identify business requirements with measurement systems  Meet with Customers, Product Support, Business Development, and IT Development groups to determine project requirements and negotiate timelines and deliverables  Develop Ad-hoc Reports, Standard Reports, Dashboards, Scorecards, etc., using SQL-based reports and other Business Intelligence Reporting Tools (e.g. Cognos, etc.)  Perform complex data analysis across platforms using Entity Relationship Diagrams (ERDs)  Assist with special projects to contribute to the overall business goals (e.g. Ad Hoc Reporting, Searches/Reviews, Program Evaluations, Quality Initiatives, Analysis, Development, etc.)  Work with the ETL Architect to handle, clean, and merge data using ETL (Extract, Transform, and Load) standards and methodologies  Ensure newly generated data is mapped to Data Mart, ODS, and/or Data Warehouse  Identify database problems and inaccuracies  Collaborate with the Data Steward in developing decision rules for handling data problems  Apply rules consistently to correct data problems  Develop and maintain protocols for how to handle, process, and clean data  Work with Data Steward to document how data problems are identified and corrected  Support the work load and priorities of other Data Analysts  Develop and maintain the workflow processes for all reporting requests  Support processes and standards that result from purchasing any third party tool QUALIFICATIONS: 2+ years experience using Business Intelligence tools to perform Report Development (e.g. Ad-hoc Reports, Standard Reports, Dashboards, Scorecards, etc.)  2+ years' recent, hands-on experience working with SQL data analysis, manipulation, and optimization  Must have hands-on experience working with MS SQL Server 2008R2/2012 (experience working with MS SQL Server 2014/2016 is preferred but not required)  Proven background in SQL Server report, query, and stored procedure development (new, custom SQL development preferred but not required)  Knowledge and mastery of SQL language  Strong background using Business Intelligence reporting tools  Strong relationship management and collaboration skills  Excellent written and verbal communication skills Proficient with Microsoft Office software to include: Outlook, Word, Excel, and Access  Knowledge of Data Modeling Concepts

Name: ATO Fraud Strategy Analyst III/II
Description: Job Description: Responsible for developing account takeover fraud detection strategies by performing more complex analysis and modeling with a focus on Small Business and Debit Card activity or Credit Card Electronic Balance Transfers and ACH activity. Uses multiple databases to acquire statistical, financial, transactional, and non-monetary event data to identify fraud patterns and activity for the creation of optimal fraud detection strategy rules. Utilizes portfolio trends to propose strategy/policy/procedural changes within assigned segmentation structure to produce optimal results as well as to provide updates for senior management. Excels at risk/reward trade off. Builds relationships with external agencies. Participates in the rollout of company-wide pilot programs developed as a result of programmed models. Duties primarily include the regular use of discretion, independent judgment, the ability to communicate with multiple levels of management and the utilization of core leadership behaviors. Proficiency with SAS, SQL, and/or other statistical and analytical tools preferred; knowledge of fraud strategy management preferred; 2-5 years' experience preferred. and ACH activity.Defines the criteria to systematically impact customer transactions and to determine which accounts need to be alerted to the detection operations teams for review and customer contact.Responds to suspicious activity across the enterprise by interdicting and/or alerting suspicious activity while balancing customer experience, fraud risk, operations capacity, and regulations.Monitors incoming fraud claims and overdraft activity for trends.Performs fraud strategy/rule definition, implementation, and performance monitoring.Prepares regular management updates of strategy performance, trends, and key issues.Performs data analysis of operations capacity, performance and alert prioritization.Serves as expert with regards to assigned fraud detection systems in order to determine how to best leverage the technology.Required Skills and Experience:2+ years of proficiency with SAS and/or other statistical and analytical tools2+ years of proficiency with SQL, specifically the ability to write, interpret, and data mine the results of queries in large data environments i.e. SQL Server, Teradata, Oracle, or similar enterprise database platformsAnalytical, logical reasoning, and problem solving skillsIntermediate level skills in Microsoft Office Suite, specifically ExcelStrong intellectual curiosity and passion for innovationAbility to communicate effectively and influence others to drive results Desired Skills and Experience:2-5 years fraud strategy creation and/or management experienceKnowledge of SFM, Brainiac, and/or FLASH fraud detection systemsKnowledge of TSYS, ICDP card and processing systemsKnowledge of data platforms such as BACARDI, W, HULC/Hadoop, and/or FRPRExperience in operational and fraud risk in Financial institutionsKnowledge of fraud schemes with a focus on account takeover fraudExperience with credit and/or debit card transaction processing including balance transfers and ACHExperience with small business banking relationships and activity a plusAbility to gather, arrange, process, and model data to support fraud detection strategy developmentCollege degree in quantitative discipline, statistics, math, economics, or computer scienceSix Sigma Enterprise Role Overview:  Responsible for performing more complex analysis and modeling for multiple products with the goal of maximizing profits and asset growth and minimizing risk and operating losses and/or other financial and marketing exposures. Develops complex program models to extract data and uses multiple databases to acquire statistical and financial data. Utilizes portfolio trends to propose policy/procedural changes within segmentation structure to produce optimal results. Excels at risk/reward trade off. Build relationships with external agencies. Name: SBA Portfolio Mgr./Credit Analyst - To 100K - Jacksonville, FL -
Description: The PositionOur client is seeking to fill an SBA Portfolio Manager/Credit Analyst role in the Jacksonville, FL market. The successful candidate will be responsible for serving as the primary contact for our clients and the Bank through on-going servicing of SBA loans.  The position includes a generous salary of up to $100K, plus bonus and excellent benefits package.  SBA Portfolio Manager responsibilities include: Managing of an assigned portfolio of SBA loan accounts.Servicing loans including annual review of loans, extension of maturing loans, loan restructuring, collections, exception tracking, and quarterly problem asset reports on loans not transferred to a workout specialist.Maintaining strong relationships with our customers by providing them with excellent customer service.Managing overall relationship profitability and portfolio risk and is responsible for the profitable growth of the portfolio assigned.Developing and utilizing a broad group of business and commercial referral sources.Adhering to confidentiality policy, code of ethics and follow all policies and procedures relative to Consumer Compliance laws and regulationsRequirementsWho Are You?You’re someone who wants to influence your own development. You’re looking for an opportunity where you can pursue your interests and your passion. Where a job title is not considered the final definition of who you are, but merely the starting point for your future.  You also bring the following skills and experience: Bachelor’s degree in accounting and finance preferred, and/or equivalent experience consisting of over four years of lending or sales experience.Knowledge of SBA loan structuring, underwriting, documentation, and credit.Good credit analysis and accounting skills.Ability to build positive relationships within the bank and capable of establishing professional expertise through integrity, dedication, and strategic counsel.Strong written and oral communication skills; must be able to convey complex concepts in a clear and concise mannerBenefits The position includes a generous salary of up to $100K, plus bonus and excellent benefits package.

Name: Issue Resolution Analyst
Description: Issue Resolution Analyst  Conducts various types of research and analysis to support the business operations to an internal or external business segment, division, group or line of business for the Polaris system. Assists management to resolve business issues in an effective and productive manner. Documents and re-engineers business processes and publishes business metrics results.  GENERAL DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES: Utilizes soft skills and troubleshooting skills to resolve client issues and questions regarding Polaris system. Asks probing questions to gather relevant information on routine and complex calls. Uses effective listening skills to develop an understanding of client questions or issues. Documents, tracks and monitors client incidents in ticketing system to ensure a timely resolution. Prioritizes and escalates support incidents and requests based on business impact and documented guidelines. Performs analyses of the business goals, objectives, and needs of the general business environment for the appropriate One Call segment, division, group or line of business. Plans and designs business processes and make recommendations and changes in order to improve and support business systems and activities and/or to deliver greater effectiveness and efficiency. Utilizes systems and data to resolve business issues in the most effective and productive manner. Develops recommendations to solve problems and issues related to business operations using Polaris. Provides an outstanding experience to customers and patients at all times May process a high volume of patient inquiries about One Call products and services, and resolve a targeted percentage of those inquiries Troubleshoots patient and/or customer problems, identifies the root cause of the problem, and uses tools and resources appropriately to determine how to resolve problems When unable to resolve a problem in a reasonable amount of time, will escalate up to the appropriate Issue Resolution Team Lead. Follows up on escalated issues with coaching and mentoring to learn the appropriate solution and expand overall knowledge Performs other related duties as required. EDUCATIONAL REQUIREMENTS: A Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Finance, Computer Science, Information Systems or the equivalent combination of education, training, and work experience. GENERAL KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS & ABILITIES: Knowledge of the company's products, services, commonly used business applications and business operations to enable resolution of inquiries Outstanding customer service skills that builds the highest level s of customer satisfaction Ability to work both independently and in a team environment Knowledge of One Call products and services Knowledge of the business goals, objectives and business operations for the appropriate One Call organization Knowledge of workers compensation industry Knowledge of industry standard process methodologies (e.g., Six Sigma, LEAN, ISO, CMM, etc.) Excellent analytical, decision-making, problem-solving, interpersonal, team, customer service, negotiation, conflict management and time management skills Ability to persuade and influence others on the best approach to take Ability to estimate work effort for project sub-plans or small projects and ensure the project is successfully completed Ability to verbalize or express complex technical concepts effectively in writing and overall excellent communication and customer interface skills Skill in troubleshooting and using diagnostic tools for client accessibility problems to applications and network ( e.g., resetting password, bouncing PU, resetting remote devices) Ability to provide appropriate level of support and guidance with One Call applications and procedures Effective use of listening skills to develop an understanding of client inquiries and problems Excellent team player Self-motivated to learn new technology and new ways to deliver support Shows enthusiasm when providing technical support Problem Solving and critical thinking skills Is resourceful and proactive in gathering information and sharing ideas

Name: Lead Financial Strategy and Analytics Analyst
Description: The Lead Analyst, Financial Strategy & Analytics works in a multi-dimensional analytical framework comprising of product analytics and consumer analytics across time. This role coordinates across quantitative modeling, technology, strategy, finance and business to conceptualize analytical frameworks to be built in a lean fashion.  The position will engage with management in the development of strategic decisions/changes and help monitor the impacts, success and/or progress of said strategies. Additionally, this position will help improve bank-wide data management and the use of data across the organization.  Essential functions  Produce overall planning and development process for product analysis and econometric outputs.  Collaborate with managers and business areas, to evaluate, scope and implement initiatives appropriate analytics and meet business objectives.  Ensure management communication related to reporting & analysis discovery  Effectively understand data resources and sources, including databases, listings or web-systems to develop effective reports.  Sustain related systems knowledge (such as SAS, SQL programming, etc.)  Maintain working knowledge of balance sheet concentrations and ratios in order to adjust asset allocations and strategies as needed.  Work on analytics for investment purchase strategy and proposals to execution team as markets shift in alignment with bank risk appetite.  Analyze key earnings and risk impacts of potential acquisition/sales in order to help decision making process.  Stay connected with the industry and potential acquisition opportunities that align with balance sheet or growth needs.  Analyze strategies to achieve the Company’s growth objectives through investments, sales, product expansion, asset development, and corporate partnerships.  Develop and maintain models for investment allocation and risk measurement purposes to align with strategic vision of Bank.  Strategic Analytics  Understand bank and business unit needs in order to provide support in strategic and analytical areas  Deep dive into analytics for new product development and deal acquisitions impact on business unit as well as total bank metrics  Production Platforms Strategy  Support strategic plans through analytics to ensure growth and profitability and makes adjustments as necessary  Provide analytical and market based support for strategies and plans in order to help optimize execution and be a value add to the stake-holders  Understand the interplay of bank financial plan, operating metrics, risk appetite, and asset allocation strategy in order to integrate bank mission into platform strategy development  Knowledge, skills, and ability requirements  Lead junior analysts on initiatives and provide leadership and guidance on key projects  Provide end to end ownership on key bank initiatives and show ability to leverage key business partners to accomplish goals  Strong presentation skills in senior/executive level meetings and discussions  Critical thinking skills and ability to display high aptitude in high-stress situations  Ability to interact on a positive, productive and encouraging basis with other members the organization.  Ability to understand and extrapolate strategic value, trends and information derived from the data, reports, etc.  Ability to relay complex information in a clear and concise manner  Ability to analyze short term and long term investment and strategy impacts to company  Knowledge of analytical techniques and financial analysis  Knowledge of fixed income, bond valuation, interest rates, micro and macro-economic factors.  Knowledge of bank balance sheet and financial product.  Training and Experience  Business, Finance, Accounting, Mathematics, Statistics or related undergraduate degree, required.  MBA, CFA and/or FRM designations preferred.  5+ years of experience in finance/banking industry required.  5+ years of analytics, risk management, investment management and/or strategic planning required.  Knowledge/Experience with VBA, SQL, QRM, SAS, Matlab, and/or Bloomberg preferred  Business Intelligence experience with Tableau or Qlikview preferred.  Technical skills required: Bond math, interest rate derivatives, and basic regression techniques.  Strong presentation and communication skills required; experience with presenting to senior leadership preferred.

Name: National Accounts Billing Analyst
Description: Job ID : ******  Location : Jacksonville, FL US  Level : Entry Level Professional Job Category : OperationsDescription : Where good people build rewarding careers.  Think that working in the insurance field can't be exciting, rewarding and challenging? Think again. You'll help us reinvent protection and retirement to improve customers' lives. We'll help you make an impact with our training and mentoring offerings. Here, you'll have the opportunity to expand and apply your skills in ways you never thought possible. And you'll have fun doing it. Join a company of individuals with hopes, plans and passions, all using and developing our talents for good, at work and in life. Job Description The National Account Client Services team at Allstate Benefits accelerates National Account sales and revenue growth by providing enhanced pre- to post-sale support to sales leaders, brokers, and clients of Allstate Benefits.  The National Accounts Analyst II researches, analyzes and resolves premium payment discrepancies for assigned national accounts. This role will support the National Account Client Service Consultant and/or Manager and focus on working discrepancy reports and seek out solutions to reduce discrepancies.  Key Responsibilities Researching and replying to national account requests related to billing questions, processing refund checks, and reallocating premiums as necessary.Managing suspense accounts using established departmental procedures, processing policy transactions for withdrawn or declined policies, cancellations, billing mode changes, and address changes.Reviews employer payment records to ensure accurate deductions are occurring against coverage elected, and researches differences in preparation for Client Service Consultant review. The candidate(s) offered this position will be required to submit to a background investigation, which includes a drug screen.  Good Work. Good Life. Good Hands.  As a Fortune 100 company and industry leader, we provide a competitive salary - but that's just the beginning. Our Total Rewards package also offers benefits like tuition assistance, medical and dental insurance, as well as a robust pension and 401(k). Plus, you'll have access to a wide variety of programs to help you balance your work and personal life -- including a generous paid time off policy.  Learn more about life at Allstate. Connect with us on Twitter, Facebook, Instagram and LinkedIn or watch a video.  Allstate generally does not sponsor individuals for employment-based visas for this position. Name: Treasury Analyst II

Black Knight offers leading software systems; data and analytics offerings; and information solutions that facilitate and automate many of the business processes across the mortgage life cycle JOB FAMILY DESCRIPTION Prepares and executes electronic payments, assists in cash forecasting and positioning, prepares routine and ad hoc cash reporting as directed, and maintains cash balances and reconciliations. GENERAL DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIESPrepares and executes electronic payments and other online banking transactions.Works in conjunction with operations to ensure payments are processed timely and coded effectively.Prepares daily reconciliations of company bank accounts.Assists in preparing data to be used in financial reporting for management.Distributes scheduled communication on time and accurately.Analyzes results and investigates variances and trends.Works with accounting staff related to research of variances.Performs other related duties as assigned.EDUCATIONAL GUIDELINES Bachelor's degree in Accounting, Finance or the equivalent combination of education, training, or work experience. GENERAL KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS & ABILITIESKnowledge of cash management activities and financial analysis along with the ability to understand and apply conceptsKnowledge of general accounting principles, financial statements, practices and procedures as well as banking functionsSkill in analytical and statistical examination for complex problem solvingAbility to create complex spreadsheets and demonstrate proficiency in the use of Microsoft Office, accounting, reporting and other related softwareAbility to prepare financial reportsAbility to meet deadlines, work independently, plan and work in an organized manner and rely on sound judgment to plan and accomplish goalsAbility to handle stressful situationsAttention to detail, accuracy and confidentialityAbility to handle daily responsibilities and special projects simultaneouslyCommunicates ideas both verbally and in written form in a clear, concise, and professional mannerAbility to establish and maintain effective working relationships with employees, clients, and the public Treasury Analyst II  Intermediate professional role. Identifies non-routine issues and routes/escalates to appropriate team member. Works on multiple concurrent projects of medium complexity. Is an active team member, contributes to complex projects to gain experience, shares ideas and suggests process improvements appropriate for level of experience. Consults with senior peers on semi-complex processes to learn through experience. Typically requires three (3) or more years of treasury experience at a public company or equivalent experience in a related discipline. Name: B2B Integration Analyst - Jacksonville, FL
Description: CEVA Logistics, one of the world’s leading supply chain companies, designs and implements industry leading solutions for large and medium-size national and multinational companies. Approximately 42,000 employees in nearly 170 countries are dedicated to delivering effective and robust supply chain solutions across a variety of sectors where CEVA applies its operational expertise to provide best-in-class services across its integrated network. CEVA offers competitive incentive packages, exceptional benefits and an exceptional culture for career building. Start your career with CEVA and build on our Foundations: Unity, Growth and Excellence. CEVA people are passionate about supply chain management.  Job Summary:  The B2B Integration Analyst is responsible for writing customer and internal paper maps for integration projects and for the coordination across customers and applications to ensure all interfaces meet customer deliverables. Additionally, the Analyst defines standard interface mappings to ensure quick rollout of SME customers for low cost and quick turnaround of low volume implementations. Provides support, when required, for production issue resolution and root causing. Requires extensive knowledge of CEVA customer solutions technology (GTN and SCM) as well as department and logistics processes.  Key Responsibilities: Serves as primary, point-of-contact for internal/external customer, implementation and customer solutions with regard to electronic interfacesWrites EDI paper mapping based on business requirements documentationValidates requirement documents provides clear mapping direction or addresses any GAPs with customer or customer solutions team to be able to define requirements to technical IT resources.Support the implementation team by acting as point of contact for interface questions and EDI data capabilityProvides proactive support for Solutions Analyst team to ensure proper handover of paper mapping for troubleshooting and production managementResponsible for holding internal partners (IBM, EAI, GTN and others) accountable to timelines and deliverables for multiple customers and simultaneous projectsEnsures all maps are thoroughly unit and QA tested prior to handover to project analyst to ensure seamless project deliveryCreate and maintain standard SCS interface documentation and mapping to ensure each project and interface maintains adheres to standard mapping rulesEnsure each customer site (SharePoint) is updated with the most current map to ensure Solutions Analyst have access to the most recent for troubleshootingPro-actively & continuously seek to improve the highest level of service from the application(s) and collaborates with global IT, BD, Implementation and operations in order to ensure documentation and processes are understood Education and Experience: Equivalent of a Bachelor’s degree in business management, IT or Supply Chain Management with a Master’s degree preferredAt least 5 years of Freight Forwarding experience and a thorough understanding of global transport logistics (air/ocean/ground) Additional Skills and Experience that Contribute to Success: Proven track record in systems projectsStrong affinity with IT systems and the related impact/benefits to solution designIn-depth understanding of complex supply chain solutions and the deployment of value creating/generating solutionsIn depth knowledge of Matrix SCM and GTNexusExposure to advance reporting tools(SQL) and business intelligence softwareAbove average communication skills at various levels (written and verbal)Exceptional aptitude – ability to quickly understand customer’s internal and external supply chain processes, policies & systems with ability to apply and further expand CEVA operating capabilitiesBroad view of the business with in depth understanding of business strategy, operating processes and capabilities, business process standardization, enabling technologies, and governanceThe ability to assimilate and correlate disconnected processes and procedures and articulate their collective relevance to the organization and to high-priority business needsCEVA operates in a multicultural, global environment and is a richly diverse organization operating seamlessly as one company. We aim to attract, motivate and retain the best people in our industry, whatever their background. We share the same passion to deliver world-class solutions to our customers. We have the best supply chain professionals in the industry and develop this talent in an inspiring work environment. CEVA Logistics is proud to be an equal opportunity work place and an affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, veteran status or any other characteristic. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer of Minorities, Females, Protected Veterans, and Individual with Disabilities.

Name: IS065 - Manager, Business Intelligence & Reporting
Description: At VyStar, we offer competitive pay, an excellent benefit package that includes a 401(k) Plan, an extensive paid technical and on-the-job training program, and tuition reimbursement--available to all full and part time employees. Part time positions start at a minimum of 30 hours per week.  We encourage you to become a part of VyStar Credit Union's family of employees.IS065 - Manager, Business Intelligence & ReportingACCOUNTABILITY STATEMENT  Incumbents will lead a team responsible for business intelligence and reporting, which includes the distribution and analysis of enterprise data. In addition, team will perform development, delivery and maintenance of ETL and data exchange processes. Responsibilities include planning, coordinating, and supervising all activities related to the testing of designated data analytics solutions and reporting applications. The business intelligence manager demonstrates knowledge of all phases of software development lifecycle and various techniques for creating a high quality team. The business intelligence manager establishes and executes a vision for the delivery of information and analytics solutions to VyStar’s key stakeholders, including senior management and internal staff. Position is responsible for executing this vision through the design and oversight of an enterprise-wide data warehouse, the development, deployment, and adoption of business intelligence and reporting tools (e.g. dashboards). The position is responsible for defining the needs of key stakeholders as they relate to information reporting, analysis, and distribution, and then using the resources of the business intelligence and reporting team to deliver solutions that meet or exceed these expectations. Through the strategic use of information, this position will help create competitive advantages for the credit union. Under the direction of the VP Information Systems & Development, this position provides leadership and oversight to all Information Systems & Development staff.ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONSIncumbent is expected to demonstrate each of the following VyStar Excellence behaviors in performing the duties and responsibilities of their job.Focus - Focus your full attention by carefully listening to and observing your client or member.Connect - Consistently be friendly and approachable. Demonstrate you care.Understand - Listen empathetically and ask questions. (70%/30%)Counsel - Recommend solutions based on your clients or member’s needs and objectives.Advance - Ensure that member's expectations were exceeded.Coach, mentor, motivate and supervise a diverse team of 6-8 Business Intelligence Analysts and Leads; influence them to take positive action and accountability for their assigned work.Take directives from Senior Management and ensure tasks are performed efficiently.Facilitate communication between testing team and other technology teams.Develop, implement, and maintain VyStar best practices and tools for project execution and management.Continuously improve business intelligence/reporting processes, procedures and workflow.Provide employee development and teambuilding for the business intelligence team.Monitor technology and industry trends for new business intelligence opportunities.Review user requirements and create specifications for data analytics applications.Work closely with project managers to ensure reporting/data meets or exceeds customer requirements.Work with peers to move from waterfall to an agile model.Participate in audit activities.Schedule, assign staff, and monitor project progress.Keep VP Information Systems & Development and other project stakeholders regularly informed of project status, risks, issues, and schedules.Participate in continuous personal and department performance improvement activities.Define, articulate, and deliver the information, reporting, and analytical needs of VyStar’s key stakeholder groups.Develop, communicate, and execute a vision for meeting stakeholder’s needs via real-time dashboards; vision must identify and create distinct competitive advantages for the credit union through the strategic use of information.Managing, creating and maintaining standard operational performance and other reports and dashboards.Solving complex reporting issues related to data, structures, tables, timing, and other factors.Providing information, including standard reporting packages, queries, and ad-hoc reporting to various end-users in the appropriate form and frequency.Creating, maintaining and troubleshooting ETL and other system interfaces.Consult on disaster recovery, data replication and other distributed data issues.Developing scripts to optimally perform stored procedures, functions, views, and notifications.Developing and maintaining enterprise data warehouse and data mart metadata structures to support corporate reporting initiatives.Developing ETL processes to move data from OLTP systems to reporting data structures.Developing and maintaining end-user interfaces to reporting data structures.EDUCATION·Four year Bachelor’s degree with a major in computer science or information systems (or equivalent combination of education and significant relevant experience)Certified Business Intelligence Professional or equivalent (candidate must achieve certification within mutually agreed timeframe).ITIL V3 designation or equivalent (candidate must achieve certification within mutually agreed timeframe).EXPERIENCE10+ years delivering and implementing technology based business solutions in .NET environments.8+ years working with SQL Server (2005/2008 experience preferred) or combined with other RDMS such as Oracle.5+ years working as Team Lead in information technology role or equivalent role managing employees.3+ years managing large complex business intelligence and data warehouse projects.Credit union or banking-related systems preferred.Contributor to project implementations that utilized a formal project management methodology, quality assurance program, and SDLC control environment.SKILLS & ABILITIESAbility to collect and analyze data and report resultsExpert knowledge of creating and maintaining an enterprise data warehouseExpert knowledge of customer analytics, data warehousing (using both relational and non-relational database management systems), business intelligence tools used in a marketing environment, CRM and campaign managementExperience with SQL Server SSIS, SSAS, SSRS, and stored proceduresProficient with Dundas dashboard environment or similar toolAbility to develop requested reports/data using SSRS, SSAS, MicroStrategy, queries, and other available data mining toolsKnowledge of SharePoint and experience working in the role as a contributor at a minimum.Knowledge of standard concepts such as User Interface, Object Oriented concepts, Use Case and basic UML Diagrams.Demonstrates the use of standard MS Office software (Word, Excel, Access, PowerPoint, Outlook, and Visio) and current Microsoft operating systems (Windows XP and Windows 7) at a level that increases productivity and work product quality.Experience with establishing technology guidelines based on best practices in enterprise application architecture and software development.Ability to lead technical and procedural standards (SDLC) for systems design, development, verification, and implementation.Must be highly motivated and organized.Multi-task and manage unstructured tasks within specific guidelines and time constraints.Must possess strong verbal and written communication skills.DISCLAIMERS AND WORK ENVIRONMENT Nothing in this position description is an implied contract for employment. The position description is intended to be an accurate account of the essential functions. The functions are not all encompassing and are subject to change at any time by management.  The work environment characteristics described are representative of those that an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.  As required or requested, may exert up to 20 pounds of force occasionally and/or a negligible amount of force constantly to lift, carry, push, pull or otherwise move objects.

Name: BP&A Lead Analyst (Fraud)
Description: About CitiCiti, the leading global bank, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citi provides consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management. Our core activities are safeguarding assets, lending money, making payments and accessing the capital markets on behalf of our clients.Citi’s Mission and Value Proposition explains what we do and Citi Leadership Standards explain how we do it. Our mission is to serve as a trusted partner to our clients by responsibly providing financial services that enable growth and economic progress. We strive to earn and maintain our clients’ and the public’s trust by constantly adhering to the highest ethical standards and making a positive impact on the communities we serve. Our Leadership Standards is a common set of skills and expected behaviors that illustrate how our employees should work every day to be successful and strengthens our ability to execute against our strategic priorities.Diversity is a key business imperative and a source of strength at Citi. We serve clients from every walk of life, every background and every origin. Our goal is to have our workforce reflect this same diversity at all levels. Citi has made it a priority to foster a culture where the best people want to work, where individuals are promoted based on merit, where we value and demand respect for others and where opportunities to develop are widely available to all.Job DescriptionBP&A Lead AnalystPartner closely with senior members of the Fraud Operations Management team to identify analytical opportunities.Conduct in-depth analysis of business functions and determine the steps necessary for improving the efficiency and effectiveness of the operation.Responsible for assistance in financial planning/reporting for Fraud Utility and conducting targeted analysis initiatives. Assists in business case development for the greater Fraud Utility. Analysis initiatives will included data gathering/manipulation, creation of models or software required to conduct investigation, ability to draw conclusions, identify business impact and present recommendations to Executive level management.Deal with complex and variable issues with substantial potential impact.Persuades and influences others through developed communication and diplomacy skills with colleagues in other areas and occasional external customers.Consistently applies analytical and programming skills along with knowledge of common financial accounting practices within Citi.Demonstrates ability to lead projects and offer sophisticated programming solutions.Advanced knowledge of Citi Fraud processes and terminology is preferred, but not requiredPrior financial experience focusing on Fraud is requiredREQUIRED: Strong knowledge of financial structure, reporting, and analytical skills5 years of advanced financial analysis experienceExperience using large data (EDW) preferredBachelor degree or equivalent experience in finance, accounting/ economics, mathematics and/or statistics is required, with advanced degree preferred

Name: REMOTE EPIC CLIENT SUPPORT ANALYST
Description: Title: REMOTE EPIC CLIENT SUPPORT ANALYST  Location: United States  Job Number: 18212620  CTG is looking for a Clinical IT Associate Application Analyst (Tier 1) will support a large Health System client for CTG Health Solutions and is responsible for providing service desk functionality in support of health care delivery specifically in Epic Systems.  The focus of this position is to provide high First Call Resolution support by responding to inquiries from the user community for requests and incident resolution for Epic application modules.  The person will also assist Management in monitoring the quality and timeliness of response to customer issues and requests, meeting service delivery goals and customer satisfaction levels Qualifications: ? Must have previous experience supporting Ambulatory or Inpatient systems ? either as an analyst or Help Desk resources with Application Specific first call resolution.  ? Prefers prior experience with EpicCare EMR in some capacity ? Trainer, Go Live Command Center, Help Desk Technician, Application Analyst non certified.  ? Must have experience troubleshooting and problem solving end user issues in a healthcare environment.  ? Experience working with customer support/call center ticketing systems.  ? Ability to handle oneself in a professional manner working in a highly stressful environment, at times with impatient customers. Must possess excellent communication and problem-solving skills.  ? Requires the ability to read, write and speak effectively in English. Review and understand customer requirements and specifications.  ? Provide prompt escalation of application/system problems including assisting in determining root cause of problems through to appropriate solutions.  ? Must have a broad understanding of information technology and the ability to adapt to new technologies is essential. Able to deal with ambiguity and change and handle multiple projects and tasks.  ? Must possess ability to function independently and collaborate effectively on a team.  ? Must be self-directed and able to work remotely  ? Overtime and/or weekend work may/will be required depending on the shift schedule. Able to be flexible when necessary to support varied shifts. Qualifications: CTG (NASDAQ: CTG) provides industry-specific IT services and solutions that address the business needs and challenges of clients in high-growth industries in North America and Western Europe. CTG also provides strategic staffing services for major technology companies and large corporations. Backed by more than 50 years of experience and proprietary methodologies, CTG has a proven track record of reliably delivering high-value, industry-specific staffing services and solutions to its clients. CTG has operations in North America, Western Europe, and India.  CTG's greatest asset is its people, and as such, we are committed to providing employees programs and processes to support their performance, hone their skills, and advance in their careers. This commitment is reflected by CTG being named a Best Places to Work in Healthcare company by Modern Healthcare (2013-2016) in North America, and a Best Workplace in the United Kingdom (2013), Belgium (since 2007), and Luxembourg (since 2011).  CTG will consider for employment all qualified applicants including those with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of all applicable local, state, and federal laws.  CTG is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer and strong advocate of workforce diversity. Minority/Female/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity/Disability/Veteran.  Job: Healthcare & Hospital Implementations
