Citi has made it a priority to foster a culture where the best people want to work, where individuals are promoted based on merit, where we value and demand respect for others and where opportunities to develop are widely available to all.Job DescriptionBP&A Lead AnalystPartner closely with senior members of the Fraud Operations Management team to identify analytical opportunities.Conduct in-depth analysis of business functions and determine the steps necessary for improving the efficiency and effectiveness of the operation.Responsible for assistance in financial planning/reporting for Fraud Utility and conducting targeted analysis initiatives. Assists in business case development for the greater Fraud Utility. Analysis initiatives will included data gathering/manipulation, creation of models or software required to conduct investigation, ability to draw conclusions, identify business impact and present recommendations to Executive level management.Deal with complex and variable issues with substantial potential impact.Persuades and influences others through developed communication and diplomacy skills with colleagues in other areas and occasional external customers.Consistently applies analytical and programming skills along with knowledge of common financial accounting practices within Citi.Demonstrates ability to lead projects and offersophisticated programming solutions. QualificationsAdvanced knowledge of Citi Fraud processes and terminology is preferred, but not requiredPrior financial experience focusing on Fraud is requiredREQUIRED: Strong knowledge of financial structure, reporting, and analytical skills5+ years of advanced financial analysis experienceExperience using large data (EDW) preferredBachelor degree or equivalent experience in finance, accounting/ economics, mathematics and/or statistics is required, with advanced degree preferred

Name: Safety Analyst (Part Time)
Description: Safety Analyst (Part Time) Job Location  US-FL-JACKSONVILLE Store 8311 Requisition ID 2018-41627 Address 8928 PROMINENCE PARKWAY BUILDING 200 Category  Store Support / Corporate  Position Type  Asset Protection  Banner  Southeastern Grocers  Full-Time / Part-Time  Part-TimeOverviewSafety AnalystJob PurposeConduct research and analysis by utilizing various databases in order to identify and validate trends that negatively impact the profitability of the business through customer and associate accidents. This position is accountable for and measured on business and departmental goals in the areas accident reduction and evidence preservation. Incumbents must be highly proficient and be able to conduct critical incident investigations timely and thoroughly and ensure those investigations are well documented. This includes using digital cctv to analyze safety risk factors and recommending loss control strategies to ensuring program conformance with applicable laws and regulations.Responsibilities1. Conduct accident investigations using various sources of information, all legal means necessary and within the framework of established department investigative policies and procedures. Support stores by using digital cctv and conducting thorough remote video Customer Accident investigations based off information obtained from the critical incident desk (CID), accident reports (APIN 2.0) requests from stores, the Asset Protection field team and/or Risk Management. Upon receipt of any accident, the incumbent will contact stores telephonically, ensure all evidence requirements (witness statements, customer statements, digital photographs of accident scene, etc.) have been met, and properly uploaded into the report. Comply with legal subpoena requests by remotely identifying, downloading and providing video.2. Contact stores, convene safety/accident huddles with the mgt. team, and ensure every accident has been thoroughly investigated, the root cause has been identified and corrective action has taken place to prevent a reoccurrence. Rate and evaluate (through grading scale) the quality of the accident report, communicate this to the store along with recommendations for improvement. Identify potential safety risks and advise store management of preventative actions to be taken.3. Report all fraudulent accidents to Risk Management and the Director of AP Analytics following company established protocol, track and manage the case to conclusion working closely with Risk Management and continuously update information into the store accident report (APIN2.0) until the case is resolved.4. Support AP department by conducting periodic surveillance of retail locations, distribution centers and office locations to resolve or identify criminal activity. Provide crisis situation support through digital CCTV, communication and reporting while partnering with law enforcement when required.5. Performs other job-related duties as assigned.QualificationsEducation Required: Bachelor's Degree Course of Study: Criminal justice, Business AdministrationEducation Preferred: Bachelor's Degree Course of Study: Same as AboveRelevant Experience:0 - 3 yrs minimumLanguage(s) Required:EnglishSupervisory Experience:0 - 3 yrs minimumLanguage(s) Preferred:EnglishKnowledge, Skills & Abilities Required:Knowledge, Skills & Abilities Preferred:· Bachelor’s degree in criminal justice, business administration or related field and at least two (2) years’ experience in asset protection/loss prevention, forensic accounting, auditing or related field; or an equivalent combination of education and experience.  · Possess a valid driver’s license with a satisfactory driving record.  · Ability to read, write and speak English proficiently.  · Ability to understand and follow English instructions.  · Authorization to work in the United States or the ability to obtain the same.  · Successful completion of pre-employment drug testing and background check.  · Certified Forensic Interviewers (CFI)/Certified Fraud Examiners (CFE)/Certified Protection Professional (CPP) designation.  · Possess financial acumen, flexibility, resiliency and self-direction.  · Proficiency using data base systems (ex. Hyperion)  · Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to effectively convey complex and detailed information to a diverse population.  · Excellent communication, presentation and interpersonal skills to effectively convey complex and detailed information to a diverse population.  · Ability to provide innovative solutions while minimizing loss.  · Excellent analytical, organizational and investigative skills.  · Ability to travel up to 10% of the time, including overnight.  · Ability to work nights, weekends and holidays.  · Ability to maintain the highest level of confidentiality.  · Compliance with all company policies and procedures.Environmental FactorsJob Location:Store Support Center Department:  Asset ProtectionPhysical Demands: While performing the essential functions of this position, the associate is regularly (67-100%) required to sit, use hands or fingers to handle, hold or feel objects, tools or controls, talk, see, hear and perform repetitive movements with both hands. The employee is occassionally (1-33%) required to stand or walk on carpet, tile or concrete, carry, push, lift or pull up to 10 lbs.Working Conditions: While performing the essential functions of this position, the employee is typically not substantially exposed to adverse working conditions.Safety Risk Factors: The employee is occassionally (1-33%) required to twist back and/or neck and walk on a slippery or cluttered floor surface.Equipment, Tools, etc.: While performing the essential functions of this position, the employee will be required to utilize a personal computer, telephone, printer, copy machine, facsimile machine and other general office supplies and equipment.Schedule(s): Varied schedules. Travel Percent: Occasional Overnight: Yes

Name: Fusion Engineer - Technical Analyst
Description: As a member of the Support organization, your focus is to deliver post-sales support and solutions to the Oracle customer base while serving as an advocate for customer needs. This involves resolving post-sales non-technical customer inquiries via phone and electronic means, as well as, technical questions regarding the use of and troubleshooting for our Electronic Support Services. A primary point of contact for customers, you are responsible for facilitating customer relationships with Support and providing advice and assistance to internal Oracle employees on diverse customer situations and escalated issues.  As a Sr. Support Engineer, you will be the technical interface to customers, Original Equipment Manufacturers (OEMs) and Value-Added Resellers (VARs) for resolution of problems related to the installation, recommended maintenance and use of Oracle products. Have an understanding of all Oracle products in their competencies and in-depth knowledge of several products and/or platforms. Also, you should be highly experienced in multiple platforms and be able to complete assigned duties with minimal direction from management. In this position, you will routinely act independently while researching and developing solutions to customer issues.  Job duties are varied and complex utilizing independent judgment. May have project lead role. 4 years experience with Core products or five years experience with Applications products and have a technical degree i.e., BS Computer Science/Management Information Systems/Science/ Engineering/Math/Physics/Chemistry with a 3.0 GPA OR (for Applications) proven professional/ technical experience, i.e., demonstrating an understanding of Applications at a functional and technical level (preferably Oracle) Oracle is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability and protected veterans status or any other characteristic protected by law.* Are you interested in being part of a dynamic andfast paced team supporting Oracle s newest Supply Chain Management andManufacturing offering? At Oracle Fusion, we deliverSupply Chain Management / Manufacturing solutions in the Cloud (SaaS) and on-premiseto leading companies worldwide, across multiple industries. _Department Description:_* The Fusion Supply Chain ManagementSupport Team, located in Colorado Springs, Colorado is expanding to support ourrapidly increasing customer base in the Cloud (SaaS). The team partnerswith Oracle Development in supporting early adopters and many other newcustomers. This is a unique opportunity to be part of the future ofOracle Support and help shape the product and the organization to benefit ourcustomers and our employees. _Position Overview_**_Technical Support Engineer:_* This position is forsupportingFusion Applications (Discrete Manufacturing, Production Planning, Maintenance,Sales & Operations Planning, Order Management, Product Development, and Inventory). _Job Responsibilities:_*Research, resolve and respond to complex issues across the Application product lines and product boundaries in accordance with current standards.Demonstrate strong follow-through and consistently keep commitments to customers and partners.Ensure that each and every customer is handled with a consummately professional attitude and the highest possible level of service.Take ownership and responsibility for priority customer cases where and when required.Review urgent and critical incidents for quality.Queue reviews with engineers to ensure quality and efficiency of support.Report high visibility cases, escalations, customer trends to management.Act as information resource to the management team.Contribute to an environment that encourages information sharing, team-based resolution activity, cross training and an absolute focus on resolving customer cases as quickly and effectively as possible.Participate in projects that enhance the quality or efficiency of support.Participate in system and release testing, as needed.Act as a role model and mentor for other engineers.Work with Oracle Development/Support Development for product-related issues.Demonstrate core competencies (employ sound business judgment, creative and innovative ways to solve problems, strong work ethic, and do whatever it takes to get the job done)._Candidate Profile:_* Oracle Software Supportis growing its Fusion Supply Chain Management / Manufacturing Support team.  As part of this team,you will learn the latest technology and help influence product supportability,usability, maintenance, and installation/configuration.  The team works closelywith the Fusion Development team, as well as other Oracle teams, directlyinvolved in Fusion Products.  If you are interested injoining the support team for a product in its early stages and help shape thefuture of Fusion products and Fusion customers alike, then this is the place tobe. If you believe you meet the requirements below, we would be interested infinding out more about you.  As a SupportEngineer, you will be expected to have:  Skillsin using industry standard tools and techniques.  Exceptionaldiagnostic and troubleshooting abilities. _Behavioral_*Detail-oriented.Excellent communication skills, in terms of being able to convey technical and functional knowledge and solutions in highly escalated situations to executives, support personnel and customer personnel.Well-developed listening skills, with ability to discern core issues in an environment where it may be difficult to determine the symptoms and cause.Good organizational skills that facilitate the generation of coherent action plans that meet participant needs and lead to problem resolution as quickly as possible.Fast and flexible problem solving aptitude so as to be able to adjust resolution plans as new data for given problems is obtained.Ability to persevere in the face of obstacles and ensure customers success.Able to work well with limited daily supervision.Process orientation preferred.Self-starter._Technical &Analytical_*Well-developed troubleshooting skills in the area of functional or technical domains of enterprise business application environments as listed in the respective posting.Ability to analyze details and synthesize the "big picture", frequently working with incomplete or ambiguous data.Creative use of industry standard tools to aid in the diagnostic process.Knowledge in one of the following areas is seen as an advantage: XML, Java, J2EE, Oracle ADF, SOA and Web Services._Education_*B.S. (Computer Science, Information Systems, Science, Mathematics, Physics, or Chemistry) with a 3.0 GPA and/or:Other qualifications and experience, such as proven professional/technical experience in demonstrating an understanding of Applications at a functional and technical level (preferably Oracle)._Top_**_4skill sets / technologies in the idealcandidate: _*Strong Supply Chain / Procurement functional knowledge.Excellent communication skills dealing with customers (internally and externally).Exceptional diagnostic and troubleshooting skills.Desire to learn new technologies. As a member ofthe Support organization, your focus is to deliver post-sales support andsolutions to the Oracle customer base while serving as an advocate for customerneeds. This involves resolving post-sales non-technical customer inquiries viaphone and electronic means, as well as, technical questions regarding the useof and troubleshooting for our Electronic Support Services. A primary point ofcontact for customers, you are responsible for facilitating customerrelationships with Support and providing advice and assistance to internalOracle employees on diverse customer situations and escalated issues.  As a Sr. Support Engineer, you will be the technical interface to customers,Original Equipment Manufacturers (OEMs) and Value-Added Resellers (VARs) forresolution of problems related to the installation, recommended maintenance anduse of Oracle products. Have an understanding of all Oracle products in theircompetencies and in-depth knowledge of several products and/or platforms. Also,you should be highly experienced in multiple platforms and be able to completeassigned duties with minimal direction from management. In this position, youwill routinely act independently while researching and developing solutions tocustomer issues.  Job duties are varied and complex utilizing independent judgment. May haveproject lead role. 4 years experience with Core products or five years experience with Applications products and have a technical degree i.e., BSComputer Science/Management Information Systems/Science/Engineering/Math/Physics/Chemistry with a 3.0 GPA OR (for Applications) provenprofessional/ technical experience, i.e., demonstrating an understanding ofApplications at a functional and technical level (preferably Oracle) Oracle is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicantswill receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion,sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability andprotected veterans status or any other characteristic protected by law.**Job:** **Support**Organization:** **Oracle**Title:** *Fusion Engineer - Technical Analyst**Location:** *United States**Requisition ID:** *18001CX1**Other Locations:** *US-FL,Florida-Orlando, US-CO,Colorado-Colorado Springs*

Name: Correspondence Analyst, I (Call Centers)
Description: Leveraging deep integrations into retailers’ point-of-sale systems, InComm provides connectivity to a variety of service providers that allow consumers to conduct everyday business at more than 450,000 points of retail distribution. Whether those consumers are activating prepaid products, paying bills, enjoying real-time discounts through a membership card, purchasing digital goods in-store or adding funds to an online account, InComm is there to provide unique gift-gifting opportunities, cater to on-the-go shoppers, deliver added value through loyalty programs and serve cash-based consumers. With 186 global patents, InComm is headquartered in Atlanta with a presence in 30 countries. Learn more at www.incomm.com or connect with us on www.twitter.com/incomm, www.facebook.com/incomm, www.linkedin.com/company/incomm or www.incomm.com/blog. About This Opportunity This position will be responsible for the analysis, troubleshooting and follow up on external customer correspondence. Position will also have audit and process completion components regarding specific policies outlined. Statistical calculation and reporting will be required as assigned. Keen awareness regarding specific customer and/or employee behavioral patterns or encumbrances needed to identify areas of potential improvement both internally and externally for higher customer satisfaction. Provide and maintain the highest level of quality and commitment to customer excellence to both internal and external customers. Responsibilities Verification compliance audits providing necessary feedback to management for group and individual coaching regarding compliance and completion of card upgrades.Tracking, analysis and reporting of internal and external web correspondence.Provide timely, accurate and courteous responses to Web Inquiries with timeframe established by management. Typically 24 hours.Compliance audit and completion of Efaxes including departmental routing, card upgrades and reporting as needed.Assist with escalated calls as needed.Assist with inbound calls as needed.Initiate outbound calls as needed for customer follow up and/or resolution.Assist with Idology checks for CSR’s as needed.Maintain awareness of system speed and failures and communicate to Management for resolutionHandle special projects as necessaryAssist CSR’s with questions through proactive issue/problem identification and communication. Qualifications Position involves the ability to work at a desk while using a telephone/headset and computer to talk and correspond with customers, Management, employees, corporate contacts as well as clients.Must have previous Financial Services Call Center experience.Must have previous experience in Financial Services process and procedures.Must have previous experience in Financial Services policies and banking compliance requirements and regulations.Must have demonstrated strong communication (written and oral), organizational, and time-management skillMust be able to handle multiple tasks while working independently, as well as, interact well with others.Microsoft Word and Excel knowledge required.Must possess a strong work ethic and dependability a must.Must be able to pass background and credit check in accordance with InComm’s certification requirements.High School Diploma or Equivalent Internal Candidates: In most cases, a call center employee should be employed in his or her current position for at least six (6) consecutive months before being eligible for a voluntary position transfer within the Company. An employee’s performance is taken into consideration for any voluntary transfer; this includes no final corrective actions.In some cases, a call center employee may be considered for an internal transfer before reaching six (6) months of service if there is a business need. This is handled on a case by case basis and several factors are considered including but not limited to business need, performance and experience. InComm provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or national origin, citizenship, veteran’s status, age, disability status, genetics or any other category protected by federal, state, or local law.

Name: FP & A Sr. Lead Analyst
Description: Primary Location: United States,Florida,JacksonvilleOther Location: United States,Texas,IrvingEducation: Bachelor's DegreeJob Function: FinanceSchedule: Full-timeShift: Day JobEmployee Status: RegularTravel Time: Yes, 10 % of the TimeJob ID: 18073531 DescriptionAbout CitiCiti, the leading global bank, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citi provides consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management. Our core activities are safeguarding assets, lending money, making payments and accessing the capital markets on behalf of our clients.Citis Mission and Value Proposition explains what we do and Citi Leadership Standards explain how we do it. Our mission is to serve as a trusted partner to our clients by responsibly providing financial services that enable growth and economic progress. We strive to earn and maintain our clients and the publics trust by constantly adhering to the highest ethical standards and making a positive impact on the communities we serve. Our Leadership Standards is a common set of skills and expected behaviors that illustrate how our employees should work every day to be successful and strengthens our ability to execute against our strategic priorities.Diversity is a key business imperative and a source of strength at Citi. We serve clients from every walk of life, every background and every origin. Our goal is to have our workforce reflect this same diversity at all levels. Citi has made it a priority to foster a culture where the best people want to work, where individuals are promoted based on merit, where we value and demand respect for others and where opportunities to develop are widely available to all.Responsibilities:Provides Finance support and analytics for Consumer O&T Digital Strategy.Develops financial projections and provides strategic leadership supporting Consumer O&T.Support Productivity Reporting on detailed activities and drivers to achieve Services 2020 Commitments and Investor Day Commitments.Analyse performance and trends and provide financial insight to support Digital Strategy and support Activity Based Costing.Builds excellent relationships and leverages them to seamlessly overcome challenges and meet business needs across Operations and Technology Functions Leadership.Promotes collaboration and clarity across broad range of stakeholders around results, business issues and risks.Leads analysis to support Consumer O&T Leadership in understanding expense dynamics and drive decision making. QualificationsBachelor's degree in Finance, Accounting or Economics.5+ years of advanced financial analysis experience.5+ years experience in a Financial Management position in increasing senior leadership roles.Broad understanding of financial systems and problem solving.Strong analytical abilities and ability to identify business needs, formulate innovative and strategic solutions and following through with detailed execution.Ability to navigate a highly matrix environment, across multiple diverse business, systems and finance groups at both senior and operational levels.Ability to manage multiple diverse priorities and work well under tight deadlines.Excellent oral and written communications skills.

Name: Sr Actuarial Analyst
Description: You are organized and view things analytically with the proper attention to detail. You value making sure rate, analysis and financial results are reported correctly and communicated well. You demonstrate enthusiasm, energy, and an eagerness to learn and are a team player who takes initiative and works constructively with others to achieve team goals.We're working toward the mission of helping people and communities achieve better health. At the end of day, working for Florida Blue is a great feeling. You will have the opportunity to gain knowledge, develop and learn from leaders while experiencing the various facets of Florida Blue healthcare services.The Expertise We’re Looking ForYou will support and analyze activities related to the Direct Pay, Local Group and National Accounts Market Segment and all lines of businessYou will process improvement of Actuarial analyses such as trend setting, gross margin reporting, and financial forecastingYou will provide rate analysis and developmentProvide actuarial representation on cross-functional workgroups as an active participantShare forecast/variance analysis and reportingDeliver product development support Minimum Requirements:Bachelor's Degree in Math/Statistics or related degree2 or more years of successful, progressive professional work experienceCompletion of 3 or more examinations from the Society of ActuariesPreferred Requirements:Background in health field or insurance fieldSAS and/or SQL experienceFamiliarity with programming languagesPC software (spreadsheets, graphics, word processors) Additional InformationJob Type: ExperiencedSchedule: Full-time

Name: Program Planning and Control Sr Analyst(2)
Description: 172426 - Program Planning and Control Sr Analyst(2) - FL Industry  ADM Region  FL-Florida  City  Jacksonville  State  FL Rate  Up to $28.01 DOE  Duration  7 MONTHS Description  Chipton-Ross is seeking a Program Planning and Control Sr. Analyst Jacksonville, FL RESPONSIBILITIES: Analyze cost trends in order to correct errors and provide forward guidance to maximize revenue and profit and minimize cost variances.  Develop and control baselines and budgets.  Monitor schedule/milestones to facilitate estimates to complete and process scope changes.  Prepare and deliver customer report deliverables per the contract terms and conditions.  Analyze/modify cost estimates and re-baseline programs as the need is identified.  . Prepare forecasts using program resource estimates with appropriately applied rates and factors.  . Develop price/cost estimates utilizing complex pricing concepts and applications.  . Application of FAR, CAS and government accounting standards.  . Develop Work Breakdown Structure (WBS), perform maintenance and charge number control.  . Perform complex accounting and analytical tasks, including transaction processing, account reconciliation and analysis.  . Analyze program funding requirements and track subcontractor costs & fee.  . Develop presentations and reports for internal and external customers.  . Track, trend, forecast and analyze subcontractor and vendor invoices.  . Demonstrate a high level of customer focus during frequent interaction with internal and external customers.  . Lead process improvement initiatives within the Finance group.  . Coordinate and lead cross functional teams to establish decision options.  . Recognize need and provide mentoring and training.  . Develop and carry out long- and short-term objectives and balance multiple priorities.  . Identify, diagnose and resolve complex problems independently.  . Perform all other duties as assigned REQUIRED EXPERIENCE: . Mastery of complex program management concepts (budgets, estimate to complete, project schedules, etc.).  . Mastery of project management scheduling and control account planning concepts.  . Excellent written, verbal and interpersonal communication skills.  . Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite. Highly advanced  Preferred DelTek experience.  Preferred CostPoint 6 & Excel skills. EDUCATION: Accredited Bachelor's degree in Business, Finance, Accounting or related field and 5-10 years minimum related experience. MISC: Opportunity for contract-to-hire based on worker performance, worker attendance and dependability and client business needs WORK HOURS: Full-Time/First Shift  Contact  Chelsie Goodreau at cgoodreau@chiptonross.com CHIPTON-ROSS, INC. 420 Culver Boulevard  Playa Del Rey, CA 90293  Phone: (310) 414-7800 x254 or (800) 927-9318 x254

Name: Architecture Lead Analyst
Description: Primary Location: United States,Florida,JacksonvilleEducation: Bachelor's DegreeJob Function: TechnologySchedule: Full-timeShift: Day JobEmployee Status: RegularTravel Time: Yes, 10 % of the TimeJob ID: 18072912DescriptionPrimary responsibilities of the Architect Lead Analyst include working with stakeholders across the North Americal Global Consumer businessand technology functions including Branded Cards, Retail Bank, Private Label Cards, Mortgage, and Commercial Bank to envision, design, develop and deploy the technical solution for any and all systems projects. Deliverables are aligned to goals as follows (for assigned projects).- Support and sometime lead the Initial and continuing design functions for projects of any size and complexity, including, but not limited to Application Solutions Architecture, Integration Architecture, Data Architecture, Tech Stack Selection and Security Architecture- Create Architecture Design Charters for architecturally significant projects leveraging deep knowledge of new products / 3rd party external services and significant re-engineering of existing systems.Present the proposed architecture to senior sponsors and approvers.Review designs according the SDLC milestones to ensure adoption of the approved architecture.- Assist in leading key elements of the development of the NA Citicorp Roadmap by providing line-of-business (LOB) specific updates on planned/funded technology initiatives.- Working with Sr. Architect Lead Analysts and the Chief Architects in their defined domains, review new products and technologies according to defined processes including the Citi Systems Inventory (CSI) submissions, Citi Technology Catalog (CTC), Request for Information (RFI), Request for Proposal (RFP), and Proof-of-concept (POC) - Support the advancement of the Agile SDLC approach to delivery and influence the on-time delivery of projects.- Review assigned projects on the LOB release plan-of-record for architectural significance and level of engagement, and be able to translate the non-functional requirements into volumetrics for systems capacity analysis.- Drive reuse of common services defined by the Global Consumer Technology Reference Architecture.QualificationsA minimum of 7 years of experience in the field of Information Technology including positions in development, systems administration, and architecture. Possess a high level of competency in the following areas.1. Strong depth in 2 or more of the listed technology skillset areas and a broad understanding across multiple technology disciplines.2. Ability to lead stakeholders across the organization at all levels to consensus in asserting an architecture which aligns the business objectives with GCT strategy.3. Knowledge of Citi systems and an understanding of innovation in the IT and financial industries4. Directs hands-on architecture design participation on large, complex projects5. Execution of governance in the adoption of standards through defined processesArchitecture - Practical experience in architecture roles within a complex commercial environment including assisting in setting architectural principles, helping define the reference architecture, building technology roadmaps aligned with business plans and helping to institute governance to ensure alignment of investment to strategy/architecture. - Strongly developed strategic, analytical and communication skills evidenced by experience in formulating strategic scenarios, evaluating trade-offs within a robust commercial framework, developing related financial models and designing practical execution plans- Experience with JSON/RESTful APIs and Java Springboot micro-services deployed to platform as a service (PaaS) cloud [Pivotal Cloud Foundry and/or OpenShift].- An understanding of external cloud hosting providers including Amazon Web Services, Microsoft Azure, and IBM Bluemix- Strong written and verbal communication with the ability to engage one-on-one at all levels of the organization or present to business and technical stakeholders.- Technical aptitude and experience across a wide range of platforms refer to Technical Skillset- A deep understanding of software delivery including traditional process driven waterfall, agile and variances of each.- A demonstrated ability to work within a team and build consensus towards a technical direction- IT delivery experience involving infrastructure and applications through concept, development, validation, deployment, and support- Product evaluation through RFI/RFP including working with vendors and internal stakeholder groups to align features, technology, and cost to meeting the business objectives.- Strong technical expertise, ability to execute proof of concepts, effectively partner with Technical leads in Development organizations. Technology (and tools)- Mainframe application platform including COBOL, JCL, VSAM, z/OS EE, z/OS Connect APIs, Data Virtualization Manager- Database systems including RDBMS (Oracle, DB2) andInformation Architecture concepts related to modeling, ETL, and data governance.- API and micorservice development integrating both internally and externally services and platforms- J2EE architecture, development and deployment (e.g. IBM WebSphere Suite, etc.)- Integration technologies for middleware and enterprise service bus (ESB) including Tibco BusinessWorks / EMS, and message protocols/formats (JMS, MQ, SOAP, JSON, XML).- Software and hardwareinfrastructure including Linux/AIX (and/or other UNIX), zOS/MVS, Windows Server platforms- Customer communication and correspondence technologies for paper (HP Dialog), image (Kodak), chat, co-browse, video, SMS/email.- Technical architecture and development experience with JSON/RESTful APIs and Java Springboot micro-services deployed to platform as a service (PaaS) cloud [Pivotal Cloud Foundry].Non-technology - Influencing skills and preferred experience working across many areas and levels of an organization - Governance to IT Strategies, Roadmaps, Application Portfolio Management, Technology Standards Management. - Process optimization, standardization, and implementation- Good communication and collaboration skill

Name: IT Vendor Risk Analyst -
Description: Description Position SummaryThe Vendor Risk Management (VRM) program exists to assist the management of Fidelity National Financial in understanding and managing third party vendor risks within the Company. This role includes engagement with internal customers, corporate control groups, and third party vendors to ensure vendor management activities are in alignment with policy. This role includes maintaining vendor risk IT frameworks, evaluating vendor compliance and coordinating assessment workflow. In addition, this role supports the monitoring, and remediation of vendor issues. Salary Range: $45,000 - $70,000  Duties • Assisting with the design and development of the IT Vendor Risk program framework and components Supporting the cultural integration and institutionalization of the Vendor Risk Management programCompleting the daily activities associated with, but not limited to, the: Review IT Vendor Risk Questionnaires and various industry related audit reports supplied by third party vendors  Development and completion of IT Vendor Risk Profiles, Questionnaires, and Assessments  Development of the IT Vendor Risk Remediation Plans  Maintenance of IT Vendor Risk Issue Management  Support On-site vendor risk assessment process Discussion of IT Vendor Risks with information resource owners, business units, etc. highlighting issues with recommendations for remediationSupporting the management of an eGRC/Vendor Management System for workflow, reporting and content management.Other duties and projects as assignedEstimated 20% travel  Requirements • Possess 5+ years experience in assessing risks, processes and controls including experience with information security, physical security, and other IT processes and functions.Demonstrate ability to plan, schedule, and coordinate work, and able to maintain high levels of confidentiality and professionalism as well as have strong organizational, communicative and interpersonal skills.Proven ability to work individually, with a team, or cross-functionally.Great business judgment, ability to influence others and strong analytical thinking.Ability to prepare presentations, status reports, process narratives and work flow diagrams.Excellent written and oral communication skills.Expertise in Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Visio and SharePoint.  Education • Bachelors Degree in a technology related field or business administration, accounting, finance, or related field augmented by industry related training programs and supported by work experience.Recommended Certifications: CTPRP, CISSP, CISA

Name: Investment Grade Credit Portfolio Analyst - Associate
Description: Job Title: Investment Grade Credit Portfolio Analyst - Associate Job ID:****** Location: Jacksonville Full/Part Time: Full-time Regular/Temporary: Permanent  Return to Previous Page  Corporate & Investment Bank  The Corporate & Investment Bank (CIB) combines Deutsche Bank's Corporate Finance, Global Markets and Global Transaction Banking businesses. This new business division was created in 2017 with the aim to ensure greater alignment of product and sales efforts, enabling the bank to deliver a better service to clients and a more focused resource allocation.  Corporate Finance is comprised of regional and industry-focused coverage teams that ensure the delivery of the entire range of financial products and services to the bank's corporate clients. The business includes the Mergers & Acquisitions (M & A) team as well as the debt and equity capital markets (DCM and ECM) teams.  Global Markets is dedicated to building long-term, sustainable relationships with the bank's key corporate and institutional clients. It combines a market-leading institutional sales force, world-class research with trading and structuring expertise to provide clients with access to liquidity and customised solutions across a wide range of markets, products and regions.  Global Transaction Banking (GTB) is a leading global provider of cash management, trade finance and securities services, delivering the full range of commercial banking products and services for both corporates and institutions worldwide.  Job Title: Investment Grade Credit Portfolio Analyst  Corporate Title: Associate  Location: Jacksonville, FL  About Deutsche Bank  We are Germany's leading bank with strong positions in Europe and significant presence in the Americas and Asia Pacific. We're driving growth through our strong client franchise, investing heavily in digital technologies, prioritizing long-term success over short-term gains, and serving society with ambition and integrity. We serve our clients' real economic needs in commercial and investment banking, retail banking and transaction banking, and provide ground-breaking products and services in asset and wealth management. That means a career packed with opportunities to grow and the chance to shape the future of our clients.  Credit Execution Team Job Description  The Credit Execution Team (CET), part of Credit Portfolios Strategy (CPS) group, is responsible for governance of Deutsche Bank's lending portfolio as well as the management and processing of loan and loan commitment requests from Deutsche Bank's client base. The role provides you with the opportunity to work with a broad range of industry sectors and banking products while developing his or her analytical skills and understanding of corporate strategy. You should be: Intellectually curious  Self-motivated  Comfortable quickly learning and applying new concepts  Can work collaboratively with colleagues across the Bank  You will be responsible for the management and processing of loan requests from Deutsche Bank's current and prospective clients. This includes compiling the necessary information to present the requests to the Capital Allocation Forum (CAF), addressing potential issues with Know-Your-Client (KYC) adoption, Credit Risk Management (CRM), Legal, and Finance, and coordinating with the Client Service Teams (CST) and other colleagues across the Bank to ensure deadlines are met and the transactions are processed appropriately.  You will also be responsible for assisting CPS management and senior CPS and CET team members in the analysis of Deutsche Bank's lending portfolio. The analysis includes compiling data and subsequent reports to gain insights into the lending portfolio, to meet various audit or reporting requirements, and to provide relevant information to the CST and their managers. This requires strong proficiency with Excel along with strong presentation skills and fluency in data analytics. Requirements: BA or BS  Strong oral and written communication skills  Ability to handle multiple tasks simultaneously, maintain attention to detail and possess a strong work ethic  Strong Excel and data analytics skills  Knowledge of Banking, financial markets and banking products a plus  For candidates applying for positions in the US:  Deutsche Bank is an Equal Opportunity Employer - Veterans/Disabled and other protected categories. Click these links to view the EEO is the Law poster and pay transparency statement.

Name: Trauma Data Analyst
Description: Is your current role providing you the level of challenge  and fulfillment you are looking for? If not, consider Memorial Hospital, a  leader in providing quality healthcare to Northeast Florida for the past  45 years. The core of our values emanates from our continued focus on  improving the health and quality of life for residents in the communities we  serve. To accomplish this we aim to identify top talent aligned with our values  and dedicated to cultivating our mission.  We invite you to learn more about the fantastic opportunity,  who we are and how you can join our dynamic team.  Memorial  Hospital of Jacksonville is a 418-bed acute care, Level II Trauma hospital  offering a full line of services, including 24-hour emergency care at three  different locations, an accredited Chest Pain Center, certified Stroke Center, dedicated Heart Center, Bone and Joint Center, and Memorial’s maternity center, Special Beginnings.  We want you to join our tradition of excellence. Intrigued?  We’d love to hear from you. Come join our team of dedicated  professionals that are committed to delivering the best patient care in the  world. Benefits: We offer you a generous  compensation package including: competitive pay, paid time off, 401k, medical,  dental vision and life insurance, tuition reimbursement and employee stock  purchase plan along with a huge opportunity for growth as you’ll be joining one  of the largest and most successful hospital organizations in the world.We are searching for a new Trauma Data Analyst,tasked with abstracting, analyzing and coding  detailed medical records information as well as entering it into the Trauma  Registry in a timely and accurate manner and compiling statistics and preparing  reports for follow-up. Additional duties and responsibilities  include: meeting state of Florida Trauma Center standards, complying with all  mandatory reporting required by trauma program, complying with corporate and  facility policies and procedures, managing patient information and promoting  teamwork and a positive patient experience. Qualifications:Associates  degree in a healthcare related field or equivalent work experience of at  least two years with a strong emphasis on data integrity and analysis is  required.Certified  Specialist in Trauma Registry required within 3 years of employment.Certified  Abbreviated Injury Scaling Specialist (CAISS) preferred.Previous  clinical registry and report writing experience is preferred. We are so excited to speak with you about this phenomenal  opportunity. Apply to hear more.  We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at  our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color,  national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran  status, or disability status.

Name: Pricing Analyst
Description: Job Summary:  The Pricing Analyst is responsible for driving pricing, margin and general financial analysis. This includes price/product optimization, pricing strategies, revenue management techniques and management reporting. The analyst will also build financial analysis templates and models plus assist with analysis of corporate initiatives.Key Responsibilities:- Works with the pricing and planning teams to develop, plan and recommend pricing actions that drive additional profit for the company through product, customer or regional pricing projects. Supports the pricing team in modeling revenue and margin opportunities.- Regular pricing and analysis: Perform detailed analysis of product and competitive data to optimize regular prices for merchandising categories. Track and measure category performance (sales, margin, etc).- Promotion pricing and analysis: Coordinate with inventory management, marketing and merchandising to optimize promotions. Analyze results and recommend items and prices for future promotions.- Strategic pricing support: Assists in the development of pricing strategy with the pricing and planning teams. Recommends and enforces pricing policies and strategies to maintain or improve competitive position and/or profitability. - Tactical pricing administration: Evaluate exception pricing requests to assess reasonableness.- Data analysis using Excel and other database tools.- Strategic pricing projects as identified by Company Leadership.  Job Requirements Pricing Analyst Key Competencies:- Analytical: Combine complex or diverse information; Collects and researches data; Uses intuition and experience to complement data; Designs work flows and procedures. Must be able to implement, monitor sales & marketing programs/promotions successfully by insuring incremental gains from month-to-month and year-to-year.- Strategic Thinking: Develops strategies to achieve organization goals; Understands organization’s strengths and weaknesses; Analyzes market and competition for threats and opportunities; Adapts to changing conditions.- Business Acumen: Understands business implications of decisions; Displays orientation to profitability; Demonstrates knowledge of market and competition; Aligns work with strategic goals.Qualifications:- Bachelor's Degree- Analytical and detail oriented with strong problem solving skills.- Experience in retail and/or wholesale distribution pricing, merchandising or marketing analysis at both strategic and tactical levels (Preferred but not required)- Experience in pricing optimization/modeling in retail and/or wholesale distribution environment. - Knowledge of statistical and pricing models.- Experience in financial and business analysis including sales & margin- Experience in Excel, Access, SQL- Understanding of business intelligence reporting tools.- Strong written and verbal communication skills.- Ability to work independently with sense of personal ownership

Name: Programmer Analyst I
Description: WHAT IS THE POSITION? FIS is looking for a Programmer Analyst I to join our team in Jacksonville, FL. This position will provide day-to-day technical support for a hosted, web-based B2B payment platform application, its server and network infrastructure, and leveraged third party applications, to ensure proper operation of technology applications and equipment. The ideal candidate will have experience installing and administrating Windows operating systems, e.g. Server 2008/2012 and Windows 7/10 in a virtualized, hosted environment. Experience with SQL database administration is highly desired.The Ideal Candidate:3-5+ years of experience installing and administrating Windows operating systems, e.g. Server 2008/2012 and Windows 7/10 in a virtualized, hosted environmentExperience with SQL database administration is highly desired.Thorough understanding of file transfer technologies such as FTPS and SFTP and experience with various FTP clients and servers (knowledge of GlobalSCAPE a plus).Financial Technology industry experience a plus!Is looking to join our team and build a long-term career with FIS.General Duties and Responsibilities:Provides remote and in-person assistance in resolving technology support issues.Performs installations, repairs, upgrades, and other maintenance tasks.Provides effective customer service in a 24x7x365 production environment (rotating on-call and holiday support may be required).Utilizes soft skills and troubleshooting skills to resolve issues and questions.Asks probing questions based on knowledge and experience to gather relevant information on routine and complex issues.Uses effective listening skills to develop understanding of questions or issues.Installs, configures and troubleshoots systems, software, servers and network issues in a heterogeneous environment.Documents, tracks and monitors incidents in ticketing system to ensure a timely resolution.Prioritizes and escalates support incidents and requests based on business impact and documented guidelines.Maintains passwords, user access, data integrity, and file system security for the application environment.Communicates highly technical information to both technical and nontechnical personnel.Recommends solutions including new functionality, expanded processing capacity and upgrades.Participates in development of information technology and infrastructure projects.Utilizes expertise in commonly used business applications.Other related duties assigned as needed.WHAT CAN YOU EXPECT FROM US? At FIS we value new ideas and we pride ourselves on providing a wide-range of opportunities for professional growth in a face-paced environment. FIS offers an open minded collaborative culture with enthusiastic technologists. A true partner. We are dedicated to our team members and our customers equally. We strive to create an environment to help you succeed. FIS BENEFITS & PERKSCompany Paid Volunteer DayOnsite dining options and walking distance to many restaurantsOnsite eventsFitness offeringsLocal discounts to events/attractionsWalking pond on campusBusiness casual attire – jeans every day!A generous paid time off program in which the benefits increase along with your tenureHealth coverage offered for you and your family through Health/Vision/Dental/Insurance plansTax advantage flexible spending accounts and health savings accounts that allow you to pay for specific health-care and dependent care expenses with pre-tax dollarsA health advocate program, tuition reimbursement, and a group legal service plan to help manage work/life necessities401K with company contribution and Employee Stock Purchase Program with company matchFIS Gives Back Program – charitable events and activities to help support our local community

Name: Programmer Analyst Intern- Summer
Description: The FIS 2019 Corporate Summer Internship: As a 2019 Corporate Summer Intern with FIS, you will benefit from on the job training and mentoring along with participation in team projects, social events, charity work, and professional development seminars. This is a full time (40hrs/week) paid internship that will begin on June 3, 2019 and conclude on August 9, 2019.  Interns will receive the opportunity to build professional relationships and enhance their interpersonal skills. As an intern, you should expect to own the following roles and responsibilities: Contribute individually and/or as a team member to support a designated functional area, analyze business processes, and work towards goals and objectives assigned by an experienced manager. Interns will also interact with and support business partners and participate in projects that directly impact business value. General Duties and Responsibilities: Design, code, test, implement, maintain and support applications software that is delivered on time and within budget. Work closely with business and development team members to understand business requirements that drive analysis and design of quality technical solutions ensuring alignment with business and IT strategies and complying with FIS architectural standards. You will help develop and support enterprise applications within the Wealth Management business. Qualifications: • Must be currently enrolled at an accredited university pursuing a degree in computer science, math, or a related degree  • Knowledge of programming languages (Java or C#), Database (SQL), or Web technology (HTML, Javascript,  Angular or CSS) will be a plus  • Displays good written and oral communication skills  • Displays strong organization skills for coordination and facilitation  • Demonstrates a strong working knowledge of MS Office  • Eagerness to learn and ability to execute in a high pressure environment About FIS:FIS is a global leader in financial services technology, with a focus on retail and institutional banking, payments, asset and wealth management, risk and compliance, consulting and outsourcing solutions. Through the depth and breadth of our solutions portfolio, global capabilities and domain expertise, FIS serves more than 20,000 clients in over 130 countries. Headquartered in Jacksonville, Fla., FIS employs more than 55,000 people worldwide and holds leadership positions in payment processing, financial software and banking solutions. Providing software, services and outsourcing of the technology that empowers the financial world, FIS is a Fortune 500 company and is a member of Standard & Poor’s 500® Index. For more information about FIS, visitwww.fisglobal.com.

Name: Customer Servicer Intermediate Associate Analyst
Description: About CitiCiti, the leading global bank, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citi provides consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management. Our core activities are safeguarding assets, lending money, making payments and accessing the capital markets on behalf of our clients.Citi’s Mission and Value Proposition explains what we do and Citi Leadership Standards explain how we do it. Our mission is to serve as a trusted partner to our clients by responsibly providing financial services that enable growth and economic progress. We strive to earn and maintain our clients’ and the public’s trust by constantly adhering to the highest ethical standards and making a positive impact on the communities we serve. Our Leadership Standards is a common set of skills and expected behaviors that illustrate how our employees should work every day to be successful and strengthens our ability to execute against our strategic priorities.Diversity is a key business imperative and a source of strength at Citi. We serve clients from every walk of life, every background and every origin. Our goal is to have our workforce reflect this same diversity at all levels. Citi has made it a priority to foster a culture where the best people want to work, where individuals are promoted based on merit, where we value and demand respect for others and where opportunities to develop are widely available to all.The Client Account Service manager (CAS manager) main responsibility is to manage/lead/develop the ongoing relationship with Commercial Card Clients (Multinational Corporate Clients) following Implementations.This includes driving client satisfaction, program optimization/growth/development, providing day-to-day servicing, changes to the client set up, program changes, report contractual service metrics that have financial penalties, and problem resolution.The needs and dynamics of each client program and relationship with Citi varies based on the size, complexity and product mix of the clients Commercial Card Program.CAS provides a single Citi window for the client through regular calls and periodical meetings with senior client representatives/decision makers.Job background/ context:The Commercial Cards provides payment solutions through Credit Cards to leading multi-national corporations and public sector agencies. Clients include some of Citi CMB’s largest names, as well as major government agencies.The business provides the largest proprietary offering of any bank, spanning over 100 countries, 66 currencies and 27 languages. Wholesale Card Client Operations is closely aligned to Product, Sales, Account Management, Implementations, Capabilities, and Technology. There are many interactions between these groups.Key responsibilities:Primary day-to-day single point of contact, post implementations, for clients and their Program Administrators (PA) and client decision makers for problem identification and resolutionPrioritize and coordinate daily workflow to ensure operating efficiencies are achieved, productivity levels are met and metrics reflect quality deliveryImproving processes to meet client needsLeverage existing relationships to drive expansion of issuance and spend among current programsCreate opportunities for proactive program improvement in concert with Account Management (AM)Gather information and lead client through diagnostic procedures to determine source of errorsManage and own escalations through to resolution including root cause analysis, identify fix and preventative measuresProvide superior service and timely resolution for complex issuesInterface with cross functional partners to deliver an excellent client experienceAct as liaison for key internal and external business contactsFrequent proactive client communication. Lead regular conference calls and resulting action plans. Schedule, organize and lead regular client service reviews in collaboration with AMInfluence the client to ensure their program operates optimally for both them and CitiIdentify trends and carry out margin analysis to ensure smooth operation of the programCreate opportunities for proactive program improvement. Practice effective continuous improvement within Operations and with our clients to reduce errors, bottlenecks and costs.Ongoing program analysis (declined transactions, timeliness of payments, reasons for cardholder contact) Skills:  Excellent written, oral and presentation skills to interact with both internal partners and external clients at all levelsSuperior analytical and creative thinking skillsStrong MS Office and system skillsAbility to manage multiple conflicting prioritiesAbility to effectively deal with diverse personalities and backgroundsProven ability to utilize logic and systemic processes to analyze and problem solveStrong communication and diplomacy skills are required2 year college degree or equivalent experience2 years or more of Commercial Card/Credit card professional experienceWell-developed working knowledge of the business and the upstream and downstream influencesCompetencies:Ability to work in a high pressure environmentMust be proactive and prepared to investigate issues on own initiativeProven experience and willingness to own an issue and bring it to completion while maintaining a strong client focusDemonstrate ability to understand and address client needs and establish long term credibility and relationships with clientsProficient in utilizing reporting tools, applications and systemsDeep understanding of the product or process that they support

Name: Sr. Financial Analyst
Description: Sr. Financial Analyst Location(s)  Jacksonville - Nations Way Job Code 3974 # of openings 1Apply NowCompany Profile As the global leader in licensed sports merchandise, Fanatics is changing the way fans purchase their favorite team merchandise by partnering with top leagues, clubs and soccer brands worldwide to offer the largest collection of timeless and timely gear from every pro and college team online, on your phone, in stadiums or on-site at the world’s biggest sporting events. A top 50 Internet Retailer Company, Fanatics comprises the broadest online assortment by offering hundreds of thousands of officially licensed items via its Fanatics (www.fanatics.com), FansEdge (www.fansedge.com) and Kitbag (www.kitbag.com) brands, as well as the largest selection of sports collectibles and memorabilia through Fanatics Authentic (www.fanaticsauthentic.com). A multi-channel company, Fanatics operates more than 300 online and offline stores, including the e-commerce business for all major professional sports leagues (NFL, MLB, NBA, NHL, NASCAR, MLS, PGA), major media brands (NBC Sports, CBS Sports, FOX Sports) and more than 200 collegiate and professional team properties, which include several of the biggest global soccer clubs (Manchester United, Real Madrid, Chelsea, Manchester City). The company's in-venue and event retail portfolio includes the NBA, NHL, NASCAR, Wimbledon, Kentucky Derby, The Ryder Cup, Manchester City, Texas Longhorns, Pittsburgh Pirates and New Jersey Devils, allowing fans to experience a seamless shopping experience across online, mobile and physical store locations. The Opportunity The Senior Financial Analyst will be part of the Finance Team at Fanatics, a leading online retailer of officially licensed sports merchandise. The Finance team has a high level of exposure to both internal and external executive leadership and to all functional groups within Fanatics. Primary responsibilities will include financial reporting and analysis, involvement in the budgeting/forecasting processes, and being a financial liaison to stakeholders throughout the business. Objectives of the role:Support all key financial processes in the area of FP&A including partnering with key stakeholders to produce the annual budget, strategic plan, monthly forecasts, and reporting and analytical supportAssist finance leadership with financial statements and other modelingSupport the Monthly close process including preparation of variance reports and analysesCreate and develop new metrics / reports for the business as needed for use in weekly and monthly financial reportingPerform ad hoc analysis to drive decision making for the leadership teamImprove financial status by analyzing results and variances, identifying trends, and recommending appropriate actionsQualifications:BS / BA in Business required (Finance or Accounting preferred)2-5 years of financial planning and analysis experience preferred (retail experience a plus), ideally with proven experience in forecasting, budgeting, and monthly close activitiesWorking knowledge of financial statements (P&L, Balance Sheet, Cash Flow)Must have strong analytical and critical thinking skillsMust have excellent interpersonal and communication skills with the ability to build relationships across all levels of the organizationStrong systems and Microsoft (e.g. PPT & Excel) and Reporting (e.g. MicroStrategy, Tableau) applications knowledge a plusPassion for sports a plus

Name: Senior Financial Analyst
Description: Careers that Change LivesThis position has the responsibility and authority to provide financial support for plant operations in Mystic, CT. Position focuses managing key financial processing including cost accounting, planning, forecasting, and reporting. Responsible for exerting influence and lead site on the execution of overall objectives and goals of the organization. Must demonstrate the ability to work independently, efficiently, and as part of team. Reports to the Sr. Finance Manager of RTG Operations while aligning with plant leadership on site initiatives and financial objectives. Position located in Jacksonville, Florida or Fort Worth, Texas.A Day in the LifePerforms functions related to monthly closing activities.Reports on labor, overhead, volume, material variances, scrap, obsolescence, warranties, and inventory in accordance to GAAP and Medtronic policies.Performs closing entries each month.Input final data reporting system (MDT OPC).Analyzes, interprets, and presents information pertaining to financial performance.Communicate key variances, risks and opportunities.Assist in continuous improvement initiatives. Facilitate development and validation of plans to deliver 6% annual cost savings.Responsible to ensure the on-going accuracy of Bill of Materials, routers, and product costs.Prepare cost quotes as required for new and extended product lines in SAP. Perform standard cost setting and manufacturing site rates on an annual basis.Prepare standard and ad hoc reports to potentially include quarterly business reviews, monthly operational review support, capital, volume, inventory, inventory reserves, labor efficiency, yields, overtime and complement.Utilize existing standardized reporting and develop reporting as needed to allow focus on analysis and identification of opportunities.Perform annual planning and quarterly forecasting processes utilizing planning system. Lead site management through the development of a bottoms up plan. Train and engage operations leadership in financial acumen and accountability.Evaluate and recommend structural improvements in the finance process, purchases, and cost center structure that follows Medtronic policies while improving the accountability of managers and ultimately financial performance of the site.Review and validate the accuracy of inventory verification procedures including physical counts.Perform ad hoc projects, analysis, reporting and tasks as required.Serve as backup coverage for Jacksonville site.Partner with other Operations analysts to meet above objectives.All activities must be performed in compliance with the Quality System.Performs duties in compliance with environmental, health and safety related site rules, policies or governmental regulations.All other duties as assigned.Travel requirement: 10-20%Must HaveBachelors degree with 4+ years of experience or an advanced degree (Accounting, Business, or Finance) with 2+ years of experience.Advanced experience with Microsoft Office package (Excel, Word, PowerPoint)  Experience in accounting/finance planning and analysis Nice to Have SAP system experience.  Experience in manufacturing finance organization.  Strong quantitative analysis and problem solving skills.  Solid accounting (GAAP), financial and business management foundation. About Medtronic Together, we can change healthcare worldwide. At Medtronic, we push the limits of what technology, therapies and services can do to help alleviate pain, restore health and extend life. We challenge ourselves and each other to make tomorrow better than yesterday. It is what makes this an exciting and rewarding place to be.  We want to accelerate and advance our ability to create meaningful innovations - but we will only succeed with the right people on our team. Let’s work together to address universal healthcare needs and improve patients’ lives. Help us shape the future. Name: Big Data Programmer/Data Analyst
Description: The Big Data Programmer/Data Analyst will develop and manage a comprehensive CI/CD Telemetry portal, providing capabilities and services for Citi’s Global Consumer Bank (GCB). This role will enable a culture of learning and continuous improvement using actionable metrics throughout Citi’s GCB development team. This person will be part of a team designing and developing a custom telemetry portal Hadoop, Splunk, and other big data technologies. The portal will provide GCB development and management teams with real-time insights into their practices, including the CI/CD pipeline, environment health and uptime, project health, application performance and infrastructure performance.The key responsibility for this role will be Hadoop development in support of synchronizing Splunk data with a Hadoop data source. The person filling this role will also help identify relevant data, analyze, and interpret data so that the GCB team can leverage complex data models and noisy data sources to better identify bottlenecks and opportunities of improvement within the CI/CD pipeline. Knowledge and understanding of statistical techniques suitable for analysis of complex data sets is a definite plus. Proven experience in predictive analytics and metrics formulation. Familiarity with the design and implementation of data telemetry systems. The ideal person will be a multi-talented developer who understands that everything done in technology space must be measured, can be measured and should be measured.Key Responsibilities:Hadoop DevelopmentBig data analysisDevelopment support for the comprehensive Business Intelligence - Telemetry Portal.Collaborate with Product Architecture, Product Owner and key stakeholders to devise and develop cutting-edge solutions.Be an active member of the product development scrum team.Development Value: The job offers the opportunity for the candidate to advance in a technology development role, with exposure to multiple cutting edge technologies, including Java development, Angular UI development, Big Data (Splunk / Hadoop) and eventually machine learning / AI. The position will provide a wide exposure to customers and requirements across Global Consumer Technology.Essential Skills: Hadoop or similar technologiesExposure to Splunk or similar technologiesCapable of guiding and inspiring team members, peers and stakeholders to drive the best possible practices  Preferred SkillsJava Microservices developmentSome experience with Data Science, Machine Learning, and/or Artificial IntelligenceUI / Angular / HTMLKnowledge of SDLC, CI/CD and ALM tools (incl. JIRA, HP ALM, Jenkins, ServiceNow).Proven technical ability with a range of BI and development tools & languages.Ability to think out-of-the-box and give pleasant surprises to end users over the data telemetry served .Proven technical ability with a variety of reporting analytics and data visualization tools such as Qlikview, Tableau, BI Cognos, SQL, Python and R is a plus.Knowledge and understanding of statistical techniques suitable for analysis of complex data sets is a plusFamiliarity with the design and implementation of data telemetry systems and metrics formulation is a plusMicroservice development in SpringCloud.Defining and gathering metrics and KPI through automation.  Knowledge/Experience:BS Degree in engineering, science, mathematics, information systems or computer science; or the equivalent in experience and evidence of exceptional ability.8 or more years’ experience in enterprise level IT projects.Experience with application / product development, including on-time and in-budget delivery.Experience with BI / Big-data solutions (Splunk / Hadoop).Experience in and understanding of a wide variety of telemetric processes (governance, measurement, etc.).Experience working within an agile software development environment.Experience in designing, deploying and maintaining telemetry infrastructure on private and/or public clouds is a plus.Bachelor degree in computer science or other related or equivalent work experience.  CompetenciesExcellent thought leadership in big data and IT development.Strong customer and quality-focus is a must.Sound problem resolution, judgment, decision-making and influencing skills required.Excellent organizational, interpersonal, and communication skills.Ability to deal with conflicting ideas with emotional intelligence.Excellent English communication skills both written and oral.Hard working and self-motivated. Able to work effectively under pressure.Ability to manage multiple activities and changing priorities.  This position is located in Irving TX and Jacksonville Florida. We have set aside limited financial assistance relocation will be provided for out-of-state candidates.

Name: Consumer Product Strategy Analyst II / III
Description: Job Description:Line of Business Description:This position is responsible for forecasting near term delinquency and losses on the Home Loans portfolio through various forms of analysis. These analyses are aimed at determining portfolio risk and operational performance in order to accurately forecast future delinquency and loss performance for the Home Loans portfolio.Key functions involve extracting data from key analytical databases, forecasting delinquency and losses using asset quality monitoring, identifying business trends, and understanding economic/portfolio conditions. Frequent communication and interactions with all levels of management are required in order to relay key information related to delinquency and loss projections, performance trends, and variance attribution. The ability to effectively communicate in both written and oral form is a critical skill for this position. While this position has no direct people management responsibilities, it does require the ability to act independently, as well as interact with business partners (both within and external to the department). This position requires being the subject matter expert on multiple business-related and technical-related topics and an ability to independently develop and drive forecasting improvements.Enterprise Role Overview:Responsible for performing more complex analysis and modeling for multiple products with the goal of maximizing profits and asset growth and minimizing risk and operating losses and/or other financial and marketing exposures. Develops complex program models to extract data and uses multiple databases to acquire statistical and financial data. Utilizes portfolio trends to propose policy/procedural changes within segmentation structure to produce optimal results. Excels at risk/reward trade off. Build relationships with external agencies. Participates in the rollout of company-wide pilot programs developed as a result of programmed models. Duties primarily include the regular use of discretion, independent judgment, the ability to communicate with multiple levels of management and the utilization of core leadership behaviors. SAS and/or Micro Strategy experience preferred; 2-5 years' experience preferred.May be filled as an Analyst II or III depending on experience and skill set.Required Skills:Programming and analytics with SAS/SQLSkilled with MS Office (Excel, Access, Word, and PowerPoint) Strong analytical and problem solving skills as demonstrated by concrete and documented projects and analytical workStrong evidence of leveraging analytics to drive business resultsAbility to work independently as well as with multiple business partnersProficient at written and oral communication, including presentation skillsAbility to interact with various levels of managementDesired Skills:Strategic Analyst experience, including skills like forecasting, trend analysis data mining, or statisticsShift:1st shift (United States of America)Hours Per Week: 40
