Name: IT Security Analyst 5 (JoinOCI-SecGroup)
Description: Executes security controls to prevent hackers from infiltrating company information or jeopardizing e-commerce programs.  Researches attempted efforts to compromise security protocols. Maintains security systems for routers and switches. Administers security policies to control access to systems. Maintains the company s firewall. Uses applicable encryption methods. Provides information to management regarding the negative impact on the business caused by theft, destruction, alteration or denial of access to information.  Provide leadership and expertise in evaluating and developing complex business problems, frequently operating at the leading edge of technology. Recommends and justifies major changes to existing automated systems. BS or MS degree or equivalent experience relevant to functional area. Eight or more years of related experience recommended.  Oracle is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability and protected veterans status or any other characteristic protected by law. OCI Security Go-to-Market Engineer* Are you interested in solving complex security problems in a new development organization? Oracle s Cloud Security Organization is working to increase product and platform capabilities that allow us to prevent, detect, and respond to threats to Oracle s Cloud Infrastructure (OCI) environment. The OCI Security Go-To-Market (GTM) team is partnering with our internal security architects, engineers, and developers to comprehensively own all external communications regarding OCI security & compliance.  OCI Security GTM takes a big-picture security view of what we do and what we are planning, covering product, platform, process, and people, covering all types of communication written, verbal, live, canned. We empower other groups to deliver & scale security capability and operations while we focus on telling the current story and future roadmap in an honest and compelling manner.  Understand and represent the Oracle security & compliance capability set against that of our competitors (internal sense of urgency vs. external view  As a Senior Security Engineer in the GTM team, you will need strong technical expertise, clear communication skills, and unending passion for information security. Qualifications: 5 years in information security and risk management solution architecture, engineering, development, and / or program management.  Bachelor s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Information Security, etc.  Strong written / verbal communication skills.  Experience with security controls in cloud infrastructure / platform-as-a-service environments, either as a customer or provider  Proven ease at connecting the deep technical topics with the business case and priorities.  Knowledge of available security tools, vendors, and controls  Knowledge of regulatory compliance frameworks, including PCI, FedRAMP, etc.  Good interpersonal skills  Highly self-motivated and directed  Experience building and communicating roadmaps to customers, explaining priority rationale, and funneling feedback to accountable teams / management  Experience building and presenting executive summary content from highly technical capabilities and decisions  Experience working in a team-oriented, collaborative environment  Job Responsibilities  Work with technical content owners to create accurate and impactful content across OCI security and compliance, including whitepapers, blog posts, customer presentations, capability demos, etc.  Deliver strongly against established objectives, such as increasing customer awareness of security and compliance, expanding mindshare with customers, driving adoption of OCI by using security and compliance as an enabler of sales  Educate Oracle field/sales on security and compliance functionality, controls, roadmaps, etc.  Collaboratively engage with security professionals among our key customers, so that they understand our capabilities and roadmaps, and so that we factor their feedback into our plans.  Oracle is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability and protected veterans status or any other characteristic protected by law.-?xml:namespace prefix="o" /-> Please email your resume to cassandra.engle@oracle.com for immediate consideration. *Job:** **Information Technology**Organization:** **Oracle**Title:** *IT Security Analyst 5 (JoinOCI-SecGroup)**Location:** *WA,Washington-Seattle**Requisition ID:** *180015TW**Other Locations:** *United States, US-WA,Washington-Bellevue*

Name: HR055 - Sr. HRIS Analyst, Workday
Description: At VyStar, we offer competitive pay, an excellent benefit package that includes a 401(k) Plan, an extensive paid technical and on-the-job training program, and tuition reimbursement--available to all full and part time employees. Part time positions start at a minimum of 30 hours per week.We encourage you to become a part of VyStar Credit Union's family of employees.HR055 - Sr. HRIS Analyst, WorkdayACCOUNTABILITY STATEMENTAs the internal Workday expert for HR, the Senior HRIS Analyst will obtain requirements from the Subject Matter Experts and will perform the research necessary to provide the HR teams with alternatives. The Senior HRIS Analyst will then document the HR Subject Matter Expert’ requirements and obtain approval of the requirements prior to starting configuration changes. This role will own configuration for assigned areas, while providing advice and coaching across all configuration areas for the team. Upon completion of system changes in a test environment, will request that the SME test the changes prior to moving the changes to production. The incumbent will provide analytic observations and development of Workday reports, dashboards, and scorecards on HR metrics to assist HR management in assessing the effectiveness of people management practices, including: recruiting, employee relations, performance management, retention, turnover, talent management, mobility, career progression. Serve as subject matter expert and act as a key resource of HR Systems projects including Workday system upgrade processes, deployment of new functionality, partnering with HR functional areas on system related process work, and major system implementation or integration project work.ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS:Responsible to translate business needs into functional and technical requirements, to implement solutions and to coordinate & lead activities related to project work plans.Own configuration for assigned areas, while providing advice and coaching across all configuration areas for the team.Meets with the user community on requests for reporting, dashboards, scorecards and analysis needs, assesses those needs, gathers requirements and develops the best structure to maximize the functionality of WorkdayDevelops and executes test plans to ensure reporting is operating to specifications.Sets-up, modifies and maintains HR System Security (including but not limited to adding, changing and deleting, user ID's, passwords, role based permissions, etc.)Works with functional leads to complete deployment activities needed to support the business intelligence reporting, insights and analytics. Creates user training documents and implementation documents as necessary.Provides advanced support for information, reporting, analytics, and dashboard functions to all areas of the business.Ensures data quality and integrity by performing regular maintenance and system audits.Creates documentation for business processes and updates as necessary.Maintains business process configuration and identifies opportunities to alter business processes and configuration to enhance or simplify current process.Maintains organization foundation data in the Workday including, department and location data, position management, compensation administration data, performance management data, etc.Develop new, or modify existing integrations from Workday to internal and external clients using Workday technologies including calculated fields, custom reports, EIBs, document transformation, Workday Studio, Web Services, etc.Assists in leading projects for reporting, dashboards, integrations and scorecards in supporting system upgrades, changes and modifications. Name: Application Analyst III
Description: Scope of the Job The Application Analyst must have clear understanding of system(s) functionality and/or departmental processes as they relate to the supported system/application(s). Strong analytical, organizational and communication skills are required for interpreting and distributing documentation related to systems/application functionality, upgrades and enhancements. Devises or modifies procedures to solve complex problems considering systems limitations. May be responsible for multiple phases of a project. Duties include instructing, directing and checking the work of others. Must be able to work both independently and as a team member in a solution-oriented, customer-focused environment.  Essential Functions Originating action to improve existing conditions and processes; identifying improvement opportunities, generating ideas, and implementing solutions.Identifies opportunities by reviewing processes to determine any gaps between current outputs and expected requirements.Determines causes by identifying conditions that contribute to gaps or key variances; explores relationships between conditions and outcomes; distinguishes causes from symptoms and identifies primary causes.Targets improvement ideas to generate ideas for solutions; analyzes the potential effect or impact of each solution; selects appropriate solutions.Implements improvements by tests solutions; gathers feedback on effectiveness; reviews impact on baseline measures; modifies solutions as appropriate to ensure effectiveness.Continuous learning by actively identifying new areas for learning; regularly creating and taking advantage of learning opportunities; using newly gained knowledge and skill on the job and learning through their application. Seeks learning activities and identifies and participates in appropriate learning activities (e.g., courses, reading, self-study, coaching, and experiential learning) that help fulfill learning needs.Puts new knowledge, understanding or skill to practical use on the job; furthers learning through trial and error. Takes risks in learning by putting self in unfamiliar or uncomfortable situation in order to learn; asks questions at the risk of appearing foolish; takes on challenging or unfamiliar assignments.Clarifies customer interests by having a full understanding of customers' wants, desires, problems, concerns, satisfactions, and expectations by seeking or confirming information and opinions during the implementation of sales contracts and throughout the relationship.Responds quickly to resolve customer problems and concerns; keeps customers informed and provides feedback on actions taken; initiates appropriate actions based upon customer or team input.Facilitates goal accomplishment by suggested procedural or process suggestions for achieving team goals or performing team functions; provides necessary resources or helps to remove obstacles to help the team accomplish its goals.Team commitment to listen and fully involves others in team decisions and actions; values and uses individual differences and talents. Informs others on team by sharing important or relevant information with the team. Models commitment by adhering to the team's expectations and guidelines; fulfills team responsibilities; demonstrates personal commitment to the team. Performs other duties as assigned. Temperament  Maintaining effectiveness when experiencing major changes in work responsibilities or environment; adjusting effectively to work within new work structures, processes, requirements or cultures.  Tries to understand changes by actively seeks information about new work situations; strives to understand the rationale and implications for changes in work responsibilities or environment.  Approaches change or newness positively and treats change and new situations as opportunities for learning or growth; identifies the benefits of change; speaks positively about the change to others.  Quickly modifies behavior to deal effectively with changes in the work environment; tries new approaches appropriate for new or changed situations; does not persist with ineffective behaviors. Job RequirementsSKILLS, QUALIFICATIONS, AND REQUIRED EXPERIENCESkills Superior customer service skills.  Ability to test and evaluate computer software functions.  Must be knowledgeable in maintenance and troubleshooting procedures using advanced troubleshooting skills.  Relies on experience and judgment to plan and accomplish goals.  A wide degree of creativity and latitude is expected.  Excellent oral and written communication skills at technical and non-technical levels.  Excellent time management and multitasking skills.  Attention to detail and quality of work.  The drive and ability to see problems through to completion.  Ability to manage stressful situations in a calm, courteous and efficient manner.  Ability to exercise good judgment, prioritize multiple tasks, and problem solve under pressure of deadlines.  Strong workflow and data flow analysis skills, strong problem solving skills and able to acquire a working knowledge of departmental operations.  Experience with customizing build to user specifications  Must be able to work in a fast paced environment. Experience Minimum of four - six years appropriate experience.  Extensive experience with Microsoft office products.  Experience in the healthcare industry preferred related to computerized physician AR, Scheduling or Other Billing/Management Systems  Experience in the healthcare industry  Experience with computerized physician AR, scheduling or other related medical billing/management systems AND/OR electronic health record preferred. Education and Certifications High School Graduate or GED equivalent required.  Associate’s Degree or two years specialized training in an applicable field (Business Administration, Allied Health, Computer Science, etc.) preferred.  College course work and/or technical training may substitute for a portion of the required experience.  Applicable EPIC certification required or must be obtain within 8 months of employment.  Epic Certification(s) and/or New Version Training (NVT’s) updates are required based on position and must pass required EPIC Certification(s) within three (3) attempts to maintain employment.  This applies to newly certified and/or required Epic re-certification process.UFJPI is a Equal Opportunity Institution # of Hires Needed 1

Description: Job ID : ******  Location : Jacksonville, FL US  Level : Entry Level Professional Job Category : LegalDescription : Where good people build rewarding careers.  Think that working in the insurance field can't be exciting, rewarding and challenging? Think again. You'll help us reinvent protection and retirement to improve customers' lives. We'll help you make an impact with our training and mentoring offerings. Here, you'll have the opportunity to expand and apply your skills in ways you never thought possible. And you'll have fun doing it. Join a company of individuals with hopes, plans and passions, all using and developing our talents for good, at work and in life. Job Description The Product Support Department is responsible for development and implementation of all health, life and disability products. The Department handles filing of all product forms and state required reports with departments of insurance (DOI). Upon DOI approval, the Department partners with multiple internal business units to ensure new or modified forms are accurately implemented. This includes working with business units responsible for policy print, customer correspondence, marketing, corporate websites, underwriting, claims handling, electronic enrollment systems and overall product training to ensure all products, forms and processes are accurately implemented based on DOI approved forms and regulatory requirements.  This position will be responsible for researching health, disability and life insurance laws and regulations to comply with both Group and Individual insurance. Utilize insurance knowledge to provide product expertise to various business units within the company. Analyst Position will be responsible for preparation and submission of policy related forms to applicable insurance departments, responding to objections and question from the various insurance departments as related to the submissions. Upon approval, analyst will implement approved forms. Name: Lead Product Analyst
Description: Lead Product Analyst  Advanced professional role. Highly-skilled with extensive proficiency. Develops and implements complex solutions that require analysis and research. Works on multiple projects as a project leader or frequently as the subject matter expert. Works on projects/issues of medium to high complexity that require demonstrated knowledge across multiple analytical areas and business segments. Coaches and mentors more junior data analysts. Works under minimal supervision on complex projects. Wide latitude for independent judgment. Typically requires 6 or more years of demonstrated data analysis experience with at least one project as the lead on a "large" project with mastery level excel experience and strong proficiency in SQL database.  Conduct in-depth analysis to evaluate program performance and communicate One Call value to both internal and external clients. Analyze industry trends and results to support strategies. GENERAL DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES: Conduct analyses and develop presentations on book of business or client performance. Work closely with Sales Team to understand client needs to inform approach to analysis and delivery of findings.  Present analysis findings to customers and work directly with clients to iterate on key deliverables (e.g., dashboards, scorecards)  Create proactive analyses comparing our results to industry data to evaluate program performance for internal management and external clients  Identify and research anomalies and outliers in data  Identify problematic areas and conduct research to determine the best course of action to correct the data  Identify process improvement opportunities and work with key stakeholders to develop and implement effective solutions  Participate in high level business initiatives and assist with all levels of metric reporting  Performs the analysis, exploring all appropriate options, and performing constant validation against existing data/reporting throughout  Serves as data steward to validate high profile or external data to ensure accurate reporting  Monitor and perform trend analysis for the company and research report on anomalies  Develop optimal data management and reporting practices, including best practice identification EDUCATIONAL REQUIREMENTS: Bachelor's Degree required in Economics, Business Administration, Finance or the equivalent combination of education, training, and work experience. GENERAL KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS & ABILITIES: Knowledge of One Call products and services  Beginner to Intermediate SQL querying skills  Beginner to Intermediate of Tableau and/or PowerBI  Intermediate to Advanced knowledge of Microsoft PowerPoint  Advanced working knowledge of Microsoft Excel  Business Objects/Business Intelligence experience desirable  Typically requires experience in relational database structures, research methods, sampling techniques, and system testing  Excellent written and oral communication skills, especially in conveying technical concepts to non-technical audiences  Problem solving; ability to think creatively and define new approaches to analyze data and summarize findings to answer client questions and convey One Call value  Ability to meet deadlines and manage multiple priorities  Strong attention to detail to ensure accuracy and provide validation of results  Strong analytical skills and ability to identify appropriate analytical approaches depending on the business need  Strong presentation skills; comfort with and ability to clearly communicate findings directly to clients (via phone, webinar, in person)  Health care experience preferred PHYSICAL/EMOTIONAL DEMANDS & WORK ENVIRONMENTS: For roles located in office or home settings; this job is primarily sedentary and may involve repetitive motions; the employee is regularly required to sit, use hands and fingers, speak, and hear  For roles located in the field; this job is primarily active; the employee is regularly mobile and must be able to utilize transportation (such as driving), sit, use hands and fingers, speak, and hear  The employee is occasionally required to stand, walk, and lift objects (up to 10 lbs. weight; up to 4 ft. height)  Specific vision abilities required by this job include ability to see things from a close distance and ability to adjust focus  The work environment utilizes florescent lighting; noise level is moderate  The emotional demand of the job may cause undue stress from, but not limited to, moderate/heavy workload  Reasonable accommodations will be individually assessed and possibly made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions of the position  Job may require some travel based on client needs  Please be advised the job description is subject to change at any time

2014/2016 is preferred but not required)  Proven background in SQL Server report, query, and stored procedure development (new, custom SQL development preferred but not required)  Knowledge and mastery of SQL language  Strong background using Business Intelligence reporting tools  Strong relationship management and collaboration skills  Excellent written and verbal communication skills Proficient with Microsoft Office software to include: Outlook, Word, Excel, and Access  Knowledge of Data Modeling Concepts

Name: Payor Policy Analyst
Description: SCOPE OF THE JOBUnder the direction of the Vice President of Operations, will be fully dedicated to the identification, research and communication of relevant Payor specific policies and guidelines to maximize revenue as related to coding, billing and reimbursement of medical servicesESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS1.Collects, analyzes, and interprets revenue-related policy data to support revenue cycle goals for the Business Groups by identifying and communicating policy information that impacts reimbursement.  2.Establishes and maintains collaborative, positive, effective, interpersonal relationships and communication with the Vice President of Operations, Business Group staff, Managed Care, Compliance and Payor representatives.  3.Perform special projects as requested by the Vice President of Operations and/or Business Group Managers.  4.Data mining, identify useful information for billing implications and work with management on interventions and solutions.  5.Critically evaluate information gathered from multiple sources, reconcile conflicts, deconstruct high-level information and uses findings to recommend changes to revenue cycle operations, with the goal of driving increasing profitability.  6.Work cooperatively and collaboratively with staff at all levels across the organization.  7.Modifies revenue management strategies in collaboration with management on the development of necessary system edits based on Payor policy information to reach targets  8.Develop and maintain structured tools as resources for billing purposes to be used by Business Group staff to include preparing, presenting and training groups of employees on policies and methods.  9.Participate in meetings and workgroups across all levels of personnel within and outside of the organization.  10.Continuously review and monitor Payor websites for information relevant to business functions.SECONDARY FUNCTIONSUtilize Infonet and Payor sponsored websites for policies, research and information.Schedule and attend meetings as necessaryPromote critical and urgent deadlines be met by prioritizing and/or reorganizing workload when necessaryRespond to communication by reaching out to appropriate points of contact requiring support with Payor contract compliance and Payor policyOther duties as assignedTEMPERAMENTAdhere to company policies and procedures, demonstrate the core values and Hospitality behaviors, resolve conflict through open, honest, professional communication, demonstrate positive and enthusiastic attitude, keep supervisor and leadership apprised of issues, and seek opportunities to recognize others.       Job RequirementsSKILLSAbility to work independently and with a team and maintain a high customer service focus  Demonstrates high attention to detail and accuracy and is organized in managing numerous projects  Ability to identify and seek needed information/research skills  Strong analytical and problem solving skills  Excellent oral, written, interpersonal and communication skills  Ability to handle proprietary information  Knowledge of Payor contracts, policies and third party insurance regulations to insure compliance  Consulting skills  Make decisions independently with minimal supervision, self-motivated and goal oriented  Ability to manage time effectively and meet deadlines imposed by either internal and/or external requirements (claim filing, reports, contract compliance)  Ability to read multiple formats of Payor remittance advice, explanation of benefits and overpayment remittance advice  Working knowledge with use of all Microsoft Office Suite applications with particular emphasis in Excel  Competent in Medical Management System, Epic preferred  Knowledge of CPT and ICD Coding and Medical Terminology of most current versions  Light typing   EXPERIENCEFive (5) years’ experience of health care experience in medical billing or related experience.  Computer experience in medical billing required.  Prior Epic system experience preferred.  Payor experience with claim processing and/or account receivable experience.EDUCATIONHigh School Diploma or GED equivalent required. Associate degree preferred. CPC preferredEQUIPMENT & WORK AIDSMicrosoft Office Applications – Outlook, Excel, Word  Infonet and Web based Payor portals  Calculator  Telephone  Fax Machine  Photocopier  Coding Manuals (CPT and ICD current versions) WORKING CONDITIONOffice environment                            # of Hires Needed 1

Name: ATO Fraud Strategy Analyst III/II
Description: Job Description: Responsible for developing account takeover fraud detection strategies by performing more complex analysis and modeling with a focus on Small Business and Debit Card activity or Credit Card Electronic Balance Transfers and ACH activity. Uses multiple databases to acquire statistical, financial, transactional, and non-monetary event data to identify fraud patterns and activity for the creation of optimal fraud detection strategy rules. Utilizes portfolio trends to propose strategy/policy/procedural changes within assigned segmentation structure to produce optimal results as well as to provide updates for senior management. Excels at risk/reward trade off. Builds relationships with external agencies. Participates in the rollout of company-wide pilot programs developed as a result of programmed models. Duties primarily include the regular use of discretion, independent judgment, the ability to communicate with multiple levels of management and the utilization of core leadership behaviors. Proficiency with SAS, SQL, and/or other statistical and analytical tools preferred; knowledge of fraud strategy management preferred; 2-5 years' experience preferred.  May be filled as an Analyst II or III depending on experience and skill set. Job Description:Responsible for establishing and maintaining account takeover fraud detection rules and strategies for Small Business and Debit Card activity or Credit Card Electronic Balance Transfer and ACH activity.Defines the criteria to systematically impact customer transactions and to determine which accounts need to be alerted to the detection operations teams for review and customer contact.Responds to suspicious activity across the enterprise by interdicting and/or alerting suspicious activity while balancing customer experience, fraud risk, operations capacity, and regulations.Monitors incoming fraud claims and overdraft activity for trends.Performs fraud strategy/rule definition, implementation, and performance monitoring.Prepares regular management updates of strategy performance, trends, and key issues.Performs data analysis of operations capacity, performance and alert prioritization.Serves as expert with regards to assigned fraud detection systems in order to determine how to best leverage the technology.Required Skills and Experience:2+ years of proficiency with SAS and/or other statistical and analytical tools2+ years of proficiency with SQL, specifically the ability to write, interpret, and data mine the results of queries in large data environments i.e. SQL Server, Teradata, Oracle, or similar enterprise database platformsAnalytical, logical reasoning, and problem solving skillsIntermediate level skills in Microsoft Office Suite, specifically ExcelStrong intellectual curiosity and passion for innovationAbility to communicate effectively and influence others to drive results Desired Skills and Experience:2-5 years fraud strategy creation and/or management experienceKnowledge of SFM, Brainiac, and/or FLASH fraud detection systemsKnowledge of TSYS, ICDP card and processing systemsKnowledge of data platforms such as BACARDI, W, HULC/Hadoop, and/or FRPRExperience in operational and fraud risk in Financial institutionsKnowledge of fraud schemes with a focus on account takeover fraudExperience with credit and/or debit card transaction processing including balance transfers and ACHExperience with small business banking relationships and activity a plusAbility to gather, arrange, process, and model data to support fraud detection strategy developmentCollege degree in quantitative discipline, statistics, math, economics, or computer scienceSix Sigma Enterprise Role Overview:  Responsible for performing more complex analysis and modeling for multiple products with the goal of maximizing profits and asset growth and minimizing risk and operating losses and/or other financial and marketing exposures. Develops complex program models to extract data and uses multiple databases to acquire statistical and financial data. Utilizes portfolio trends to propose policy/procedural changes within segmentation structure to produce optimal results. Excels at risk/reward trade off. Build relationships with external agencies. Participates in the rollout of company-wide pilot programs developed as a result of programmed models. Duties primarily include the regular use of discretion, independent judgment, the ability to communicate with multiple levels of management and the utilization of core leadership behaviors. SAS and/or MicroStrategy experience preferred; 2-5 years experience preferred. Shift:1st shift (United States of America)Hours Per Week:40

Name: Application Analyst II
Description: Scope of the Job The Application Analysts are the primary support contacts for each application. They coordinate all issues that arise during the project for their application areas and must be very knowledgeable about the organization's policies, procedures, and business operations. Must be able to work both independently and as a team member in a solution-oriented, customer-focused environment. Maintaining effectiveness when experiencing major changes in work responsibilities or environment and adjusting effectively to work within new work structures.  Essential Functions 1.Informs others on team by sharing important or relevant information with the team. Models commitment by adhering to the team's expectations and guidelines; fulfills team responsibilities; demonstrates personal commitment to the team.  2.Identifying issues that arise in their application area as well as issues that impact other application teams, and work to resolve them.Assist and/or improve workflow including build and testing of the system, and analyzing other technical issues associated with Epic and/or related software.  3. Continuous learning by actively identifying new areas and taking advantage of learning opportunities; using newly gained knowledge and skill on the job and learning through their application. (e.g., courses, reading, self-study, coaching, and experiential learning).  4. Puts new knowledge, understanding or skill to practical use; furthers learning through trial and error. Analyzes the potential impact of each solution; selects appropriate solutions.  5.Clarifies customer interests by having a full understanding of customers' needs and expectations by confirming information during the scope of new or established workflow, and/or processes throughout the implementation. Provides ongoing support.  7. Responds to customers according to SLA policy related to problems and concerns; keeps customers informed and provides feedback on actions taken; initiates appropriate actions based upon customer or team input. Temperament Maintaining effectiveness when experiencing changes in work responsibilities or environment. Adjust effectively to work within new work structures, processes, requirements or cultures. The ability to persevere in difficult situations, overcome obstacles, and reach high levels of performance when faced with stressful work situations and time pressures.    Job RequirementsSKILLS, QUALIFICATIONS, AND REQUIRED EXPERIENCE  Skills  Superior customer service skills.  The ability and willingness to see things in an open-minded way and examine an idea or concept from as many angles as possible  A wide degree of creativity and latitude is expected.  Excellent oral and written communication skills at technical and non-technical levels.  Excellent time management and multitasking skills.  Attention to detail and quality of work.  The drive and ability to see problems through to completion.  Ability to manage stressful situations in a calm, courteous and efficient manner.  Ability to exercise good judgment, prioritize multiple tasks, and problem solve under pressure of deadlines.  Strong workflow and data flow analysis skills.  Strong problem solving skills and ability to acquire a working knowledge of departmental operations. Experience  Minimum of four-six years of appropriate experience  Extensive experience with Microsoft office products.  Experience in the healthcare industry preferred.  Experience with computerized physician AR, scheduling or other related medical billing/management systems or electronic health record preferred. Education and Certifications    High School Graduate or GED equivalent required. Associates Degree or two years specialized training in an applicable field (Business Administration, Allied Health, Computer Science, etc.) preferred.  College course work and/or technical training may substitute for a portion of the required experience.  Applicable EPIC certification required or be obtain within 6 months of employment. Epic certification and New Version Training (NVT’s) updates are required based on position and must pass required EPIC Certification(s) within three (3) attempts to maintain employment.     UFJPI is anEqual Opportunity Institution    # of Hires Needed 1

Name: Issue Resolution Analyst
Description: Issue Resolution Analyst  Conducts various types of research and analysis to support the business operations to an internal or external business segment, division, group or line of business for the Polaris system. Assists management to resolve business issues in an effective and productive manner. Documents and re-engineers business processes and publishes business metrics results.  GENERAL DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES: Utilizes soft skills and troubleshooting skills to resolve client issues and questions regarding Polaris system. Asks probing questions to gather relevant information on routine and complex calls. Uses effective listening skills to develop an understanding of client questions or issues. Documents, tracks and monitors client incidents in ticketing system to ensure a timely resolution. Prioritizes and escalates support incidents and requests based on business impact and documented guidelines. Performs analyses of the business goals, objectives, and needs of the general business environment for the appropriate One Call segment, division, group or line of business. Plans and designs business processes and make recommendations and changes in order to improve and support business systems and activities and/or to deliver greater effectiveness and efficiency. Utilizes systems and data to resolve business issues in the most effective and productive manner. Develops recommendations to solve problems and issues related to business operations using Polaris. Provides an outstanding experience to customers and patients at all times May process a high volume of patient inquiries about One Call products and services, and resolve a targeted percentage of those inquiries Troubleshoots patient and/or customer problems, identifies the root cause of the problem, and uses tools and resources appropriately to determine how to resolve problems When unable to resolve a problem in a reasonable amount of time, will escalate up to the appropriate Issue Resolution Team Lead. Follows up on escalated issues with coaching and mentoring to learn the appropriate solution and expand overall knowledge Performs other related duties as required. EDUCATIONAL REQUIREMENTS: A Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Finance, Computer Science, Information Systems or the equivalent combination of education, training, and work experience. GENERAL KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS & ABILITIES: Knowledge of the company's products, services, commonly used business applications and business operations to enable resolution of inquiries Outstanding customer service skills that builds the highest level s of customer satisfaction Ability to work both independently and in a team environment Knowledge of One Call products and services Knowledge of the business goals, objectives and business operations for the appropriate One Call organization Knowledge of workers compensation industry Knowledge of industry standard process methodologies (e.g., Six Sigma, LEAN, ISO, CMM, etc.) Excellent analytical, decision-making, problem-solving, interpersonal, team, customer service, negotiation, conflict management and time management skills Ability to persuade and influence others on the best approach to take Ability to estimate work effort for project sub-plans or small projects and ensure the project is successfully completed Ability to verbalize or express complex technical concepts effectively in writing and overall excellent communication and customer interface skills Skill in troubleshooting and using diagnostic tools for client accessibility problems to applications and network ( e.g., resetting password, bouncing PU, resetting remote devices) Ability to provide appropriate level of support and guidance with One Call applications and procedures Effective use of listening skills to develop an understanding of client inquiries and problems Excellent team player Self-motivated to learn new technology and new ways to deliver support Shows enthusiasm when providing technical support Problem Solving and critical thinking skills Is resourceful and proactive in gathering information and sharing ideas

Name: Digital Marketing Sr Analyst

Position will manage special project requirements, marketing package development, waterfall evaluation and manage offer implementation across a variety of online and offline channels. The Database Marketing Sr Analyst will also provide insight-driven recommendations to enhance strategies and drive process efficiency across the organization. Position is responsible for working closely with Senior Management/Director/Supervisors on all group level recommendations.  Role requires interaction with cross-functional, cross-geographic team members within the Citi Branded Cards business, requiring undersanding of Business goals and drivers, and the ability to consult on technical design with non-technical audiences. Additionally, role has direct oversight of day to day operations of a critical list processing vendor and strong integration with internal IT teams. The ability to bridge English strategy to technical implementation is critical.  The Database Marketing Sr. Analyst responsibilities include: Organizational Scope, Accountability & Strategic LeadershipManages offer targeting and implementation across multiple online and offline channels within one or more functional specialties.Educate marketing partners on new toolsets, and help develop and implement best-in-class customer centric campaign strategies.Provide insight driven recommendations to optimize strategies and enhance operational process components.KnowledgeWorking knowledge of omni channel, customer centric marketing techniques.Strong working knowledge base in quantitative and analytical techniques including report analysis, association rules, decision trees, timeline and task plan analysis and visualization techniques.Experience driving sophisticated exploratory data analysis and provides results to Business Partners. Influence / Collaboration Interacts with cross-functional areas at the Functional Specialty level.Primary liaison with the Marketing Segment Managers, Decision Management, and Risk to develop sound Business Requirements and work through the business needs to ensure successful project completion.Oversee List Processing Vendor team to support successful campaign execution. Judgment / Decision Making Understands impact/implications of issues/events within the marketing segments and other areas within the Marketing Information Management Group.Works with considerable latitude for decision making in setting priorities under area of responsibility.Applies knowledge, experience and judgment to less ambiguous situations requiring the adaptation of standard procedures or techniques. Qualifications4-7 years of experience in a digital or database marketing role, preferably in financial services.4-7 years of strategic business analysis; aptitude in displaying and communicating data analysis and results within a CRM focused environment.Experience with Direct marketing of credit card offers across digital/online channels and traditional offline channels preferred.Understanding of legal, regulatory environment and experience within a highly controlled environment preferred.Experience with consumer lending or 3rd party marketing preferred.Experience with digital marketing and vendor management preferred.Acumen working in a technical environment to solve business related problems. SQL required and SAS experience is a plus.Experience analyzing marketing efforts.Optimization experience a plus.

Name: Cons Prod Strategic Analyst III
Description: Job Description: Manage and perform strategic analyses to improve portfolio risk, profitability, origination and performance analysis and operational performance for the Consumer Vehicle Lending channel, including Core and Flow channels. Responsibilities may include reviewing variances to projections or forecasts for credit losses and loan balance liquidation at the vintage level. Requires pulling and validating data on one's own using advance programming tools. Generating results against risk limits and targets in alignment with a risk appetite, credit policy metrics or strategy governance. Requires interaction with business partners in Credit, Sales, Product, Collections, Servicing, GT&O, Finance, Risk and Compliance to present results and understand issues impacting the business, communication skills must be strong. Reviewing and monitoring loan origination quality for senior management; identifying and analyzing trends based on economic, market and portfolio conditions, recommending credit strategy changes for loan purchase or underwriting as it relates to credit strategies for Auto or RV loans (feedback loop). Ability to deal with data at the element or aggregated level. Responsible for documentation development, including writing system requirements, actively participating in design meetings and guiding credit strategy changes which may include being a part of negotiations for the FLOW channel. Support implementation, testing and training of Credit Strategy changes for Consumer Products. Participate and possibly provide data or analytical input for audits, credit review or government exams. Strong aptitude to interpret numeric trends through a comprehensive understanding of data in consumer lending. Demonstrates resilience for change. Self starter with a results driven mentality. 3+ years Credit Strategy Analysis experience preferred.  ***Role may also be filled by highly qualified Analyst II*** Required Skills:Bachelor's degree required and/or Masters degree in a quantitative discipline.Experience with a programming language such as SQL, SAS.Expertise in MS Office (Excel, PowerPoint) or Tableau.Ability to develop quantitative output using appropriate tools (ex SAS, Xeno, Knowledge Seeker) against numerous large data-sets for identifying and optimizing key business metrics of credit default risk, prepayment risk or collateral recovery risk with a proven ability to interpret results and communicate findings succinctly to senior leadership.Ability to effectively analyze origination concentrations and trends, optimize profit of new application volume within expected risk tolerances, and proactively identify opportunities to support existing or new business strategies.Ability to independently manage and defend quantitative analytics with sound documentation of assumptions, limitations, conclusions and recommendations within specified timelines.Ability to independently drive strategic improvements while adhering to and successfully navigating established governance routines.Ability to translate analytics into business requirements, complete a comprehensive risk assessment inclusive of multiple partners, and usher that change through system implementation including testing support and procedures development.Proactive with intellectual curiosity towards the business and data trends. Willing to take the next step or ability to predict the next step with little direction and oversight.Very strong written and verbal communication skills.Strong negotiation skills.Desired Skills:3+ Years in a Financial Business Setting, Risk Management or Risk/Marketing Analytics type functional role.A solid working knowledge of statistical and/or financial analyses/modeling and the proven ability to apply that knowledge to business data and strategies.An understanding of general financial concepts (IRR, ROE, ROA, RAS, RANIM, RAM, etc) and an understanding of credit/collateral based concepts such as FICO, credit scores, LTV%, accept/reject, term, DTI/PTI.Logically solve problems in an expedient manner.Proven history of using good planning and process management skills, able to run several analytical projects independently at the same time and prioritize within given guidelines.Ability to manage across multiple functional areas as well the ability to influence others at all levels of the organization, including governance teams and external partners.Positive attitude towards change and ability to think out of the box to solve business questions.Shift:1st shift (United States of America)Hours Per Week:40

Name: Treasury Analyst II
